# hardcore_pop - BezTeban_Hardcore_Pop_3
[DESCRIPTION]
A dark, swagger-heavy West Coast G-House remix at 124–126 BPM, blending hip-hop attitude with rolling bass-house energy. The track centers on a gritty analog bassline, distorted mid-bass growls, tight LA-club percussion, and minimalist FM synth stabs. Vocals are delivered in a seductive, low-spoken Serbian female tone—dry, intimate, rhythmic—paired with pitched-down vocal chops that form the main hook. The drops hit with heavy G-house wobble bass, open hats, and short siren FX, while verses stay stripped and moody with tight kick patterns and whispered lines. The “Ne želim te / Trebam te” refrain becomes a hypnotic club mantra, looped and chopped into the groove. The entire arrangement is built for DJs: long intros, powerful drops, and infectious vocal fragments that lock perfectly into the bassline. Sleek, dirty, confident — a pure  club grinder.

[LYRICS]
[GlobalMix–West Coast G-House / Dark Bass-House ~124–126 BPM.Deep sub(45–55 Hz) sidechained 6–8 dB to kick.Kick:hard transient,short tail,punchy body.Snares/claps sharp 4–6 kHz with tight room reverb.Hats minimal 1/8 + syncopated 1/16 shakers.Perc:dirty hip-hop style snaps,low-metallic hits,vocal breath FX.Bass:heavy analog G-house bassline,long release,distorted mids,mono<120 Hz.Synths:minimal stabs,FM stabs,west-coast chord shots.Vocal:low intimate female voice,no autotune,salty attitude,slight saturation,compressed tight,HPF 110 Hz.Dry in verses,wide in drops;spoken whispers layered as rhythmic elements.FX:hip-hop sirens,short downlifters,reverse swells,sub drops.Master:-6.5 LUFS,club loud.]

[Structure–DJIntro(16 bars vocal chops+filtered bass)->Verse1(minimal drums)->Verse2(bass enters)->Build(siren+snare roll)->Drop1(bass-house groove)->StrofaHook(tech-house vocal mantra)->Refren(bass stabs+vocal loop)->VerseAlt->Drop2(stronger bass+percs)->Outro(filtered).]

⭐ DJ INTRO – Vocal Hook Setup

([VoxChop]-“Ne… Ne… Trebam te…” chopped 1/4 + 1/8)
([BassFilter]-lowpassed G-house bass pumping)
([SirenFX]-short west-coast siren)
([ClapDry]-minimal clap groove)
(lyrics begin below)

⭐ [Verse 1]

Ustajem
([VoxLow]-dry whispered tone)
Jer ne mogu da spavam
([KickSoft]-muted 4/4)
Nije da nisam pokušavala
([PercClick]-tight click groove)
Bez tebe lako ne ide
([BassTease]-sub glides,still filtered)
(nisam se ni zavaravala)
([FXReverse]-soft reverse swell)
Više se nikoga ne bojim
([VoxStereo]-slight widen)
ma šta da se desi ....
([HatGhost]-tiny 1/16 hat)
(ja bih dane s tobom da brojim)
([RiserSmall]-8 bar riser)

⭐ [Verse 2]

Sama bih sebe noćas rado prevarila
([BassFull]-G-house bass enters heavy)
I svako osećanje iz glave izbacila
([ClapThick]-roomy clap)
Ali nešto uvek me zaustavi
([VoxDryClose])
Pita zašto vatrom na vatru da ne uzvrati
([FXVocalStab]-pitched-down stab)
Zar te laži teške ne pogađaju?“
([Delay1/4]-vocal throw)

⭐ BUILD – West Coast G-House Style

([SnareRoll]-1/8 to 1/16)
([SirenUp]-LA-style rising siren)
([VoxChopLow]-“bežim… bežim…”)
([SubRise]-sub tension)
Last bar:
([SilenceBeat]-kick drops out)

⭐ DROP 1 – G-HOUSE MAIN DROP

I šta je to u meni
([BassHit]-big sub hit)
Što se uvek zaljubi u one koji ne smeju
([GHouseBass]-rolling distorted bassline)
Da zavole? Pa se na kraju
([HatOpen]-open hat pulse)
što sam verovala opet sama kajem
([DROP]-full groove,bass growls,FM stabs)

Zar da uvek trčim tebi
([VoxSpokenLow]-dry,panned L)
Kad me zoveš
([StabDark]-FM stab)
A ja bežim
([VoxSpokenLow]-panned R)

([BassWobble])

([PadDarkWarm])

([VoxChop1/8]-“nije mi bitno”)

[DESCRIPTION]
A dark, swagger-heavy West Coast G-House remix at 124–126 BPM, blending hip-hop attitude with rolling bass-house energy. # hardcore_pop - Big Day Crushers_Hardcore_Pop_1
[DESCRIPTION]
An 134 bpm dynamic tech house track , car siren, tire screeching, dynamic, dance non-stop groove paired with silk smooth voices, no autotune, just clear vocals

[Verse]

(that’s all that matters)

([Metal scrape soft] - shrrrk)
(no disasters)

([Breath exhale close] - haaah)
(don’t get upset)

([Snare tick] - tchk)
(no fights)
We just turned up for a couple of free drinks tonight
([Crowd cheer tiny] - ayyyo)
(tonight) ([BV-F harmony pad] - “tonight”)

[Verse 2]

([Vinyl pop] - pft)
(she said)
([BV-F echo] - “she said”)
"It's kinda funny
([Finger snap] - snap)
(kinda funny)

([Kick + clap] - boom-clap)
(we’re here now)

([Vinyl pop soft] - pft)

[DESCRIPTION]
An 134 bpm dynamic tech house track , car siren, tire screeching, dynamic, dance non-stop groove paired with silk smooth voices, no autotune, just clear vocals

[LYRICS]
[Verse]

And if you gettin' bored
Well
Baby
I got something in store
With you and me
It's easy 'cause we both play the fool
And if you gettin' bored
Well
Baby
I got something for you

# hardcore_pop - Blue Apartment_Hardcore_Pop_1
[DESCRIPTION]
A Balkan-infused tech-bass weapon built for explosive club moments. Heavy tapan rolls and tight darbuka fills drive a frantic rhythmic undercurrent beneath a grunting mid-bass wobble glued to a deep, wide sub. Cowbell sync hits punctuate the groove, while zurle appears only as a filtered, distorted, swung texture—folklore transformed into modern club identity. The vocal phrases become swaggering loops and call-and-response stabs that bounce off the bassline, especially during the massive drops where synth growls, tapan flurries, and sidechained zurle swells tear the floor open. Breaks strip to hypnotic percussion and airy pads before slamming back into bass-heavy festival chaos. Designed to make crowds scream, stomp, and lose themselves—this is where Balkan culture mutates into peak-time tech-house power.

[LYRICS]
[GlobalMix–Balkan Tech Bass ~125–128 BPM. Kick tight/punchy 60–90 Hz; add subtle tapan layer for body. Bass: grunting mid-bass wobble, distorted, sidechain 6–8 dB, sub wide 40–60 Hz. Perc: heavy tapan rolls, darbuka fills, swung cowbell, filtered zurle stabs (distorted, no pure folk tone). Hats 1/8 + 1/16 fills. Vocals clean/dry in verses; chopped, stuttered, Balkan-style rhythmic gating in drops. FX: risers, reverse breaths, tapan flurries, zurle filters, pitch-downs. Master: -6.5 LUFS, stereo wide.]

⭐ DJ INTRO — Balkan Chop Hook (16 bars)

([VoxChop1/8] – “great blue… blue… blue…”)
([BassFilterLPF] – wobble tease)
([TickPerc] – darbuka click accents])
([TapanSoftRoll] – low rumbling roll])
([CowbellSwing] – subtle syncopation])

⭐ GROOVE LOOP A — Tech-Bass Bounce + Balkan Pulse

([VoxLoop] – “get away… get away…”])
([BassOpen] – filter opening 16 bars])
([DarbukaGhostHits] – 1/16 swings])
([ZurleFilterThin] – rhythmic texture])
([VoxDelayShort] – “blue” accents])

⭐ VERSE 1 — Clean, Upfront, Balkan Subtlety Behind It

I've got some plans for us
 ([VoxCloseDry])

All those days in the city
 ([HatGhost1/16] + light darbuka tick])

Got the best of us
 ([BassHintLPF])

And we're all wearing down
 ([PadSmallAir])

Could use some time in a bed in a quiet town
 ([PercSoft])

Some time alone with you
 ([VoxWarmMono])

Got a couple ideas that we could get up to
 ([ReverseBreathFX])

Some things we could get down on
 ([BassPulse])

So let's blow this joint
 ([SnareLiftSoft] + [TapanRollMini])

Leave behind this town for the
 ([VoxDelay1/8D])

Great blue
 ([VoxChopSmall] – “great… great… blue”])

All that we've been through
 ([BassTease])

Seems like we could use some time away
 ([PadThin])

All of the lies that were so true
 ([PercSnap])

Would you like to
 ([VoxReverseLead])

Get away
 ([BuildPerc1/4] + darbuka fills])

For the night
 ([SnareRoll1/8→1/16])

In the great blue
 ([SilenceCue] – 1 beat pre-drop])

⭐ DROP 1 — Balkan Tech-Bass Explosion

([BassFullGrowl] – grunting, mid-bass wobble])
([ClapWide])
([HatOpen])
([StabBass1/4] – syncopated stabs])

→ Balkan injections
([TapanFlurry] – rapid rolls on transitions])
([DarbukaBounce] – accents on offbeats])
([ZurleDistortedSwipe] – filtered upward motion])

VOCAL CHOPS:
([VoxChopHook] – “get away… get away… blue… blue…”])
([VoxStutter] – “apartment… apart-apartment”])

⭐ CHORUS — Riding the Drop Groove

I've got a blue apartment
 ([VoxFront])

And I'm feelin' blue
 ([SlapDelayShort])

A blue apartment
 ([VoxDoubleWide])

I'd rather have you
 ([BassStabResponse] + [CowbellSync])

⭐ BREAK — Airy + Balkan Texture

([BassLPF])
([PadAirWide])
([VoxSpokenLow] – “get away with me…”])
([HatDropOut])
([ZurleLowDrone] – filtered, haunting])
([VoxReverseChop] – “blue… blue… blue…”])

⭐ VERSE 2 — Groovy, Breezy, Still Balkan

Baby
 ([VoxCloseDry])

We could sleep in
 ([PercSoft])

Maybe wake up to birds
 ([PadLight])

Hear them sing again
 ([HatGhost])

Drink some coffee outside
 ([BassHintLPF])

With no traffic in sight
 ([PercClickWide])

With no rush to arrive
 ([VoxDelayShort])

With not a single plan
 ([PadThin])

Just the will of our hearts and the works of our hands
 ([ReverseBreathFX])

To make something beautiful
 ([BassPulseMid])

To leave behind our past
 ([PercRise])

Live in
 ([SnareLift] + [TapanRollMini])

The blue
 ([VoxStutter] – “blue-blue-blue”])

All that we've been through
 ([PadSwellSmall])

Seems like we could use some time away
 ([HatAdd1/16])

All of the lies that were so true
 ([PercSnap])

Would you like to
 ([VoxReverseLead])

Get away
 ([MiniBuild] + darbuka fills])

For the night
 ([SnareRoll1/8→1/16])

In the great blue
 ([SilenceCue])

⭐ DROP 2 — BALKAN CHAOS MODE (Bigger, Wilder)

([BassGrowlBright])
([HatOpenHigher])
([ClapThicker])
([TapanFlurryMax])
([DarbukaMachineGun] – rapid-fire fills])
([ZurleDistortedLead] – pitched, filtered])

([VoxMegaChop] – “great blue… get away… blue apartment… you… you… you…”])
([BassStabAnswer])
([CowbellSyncLoud])

([ReverbThrow] – “blue” exploding outward])

⭐ CHORUS REPRISE

I've got a blue apartment
 ([VoxFront])

And I'm feelin' blue
 ([SlapDelay])

A blue apartment
 ([VoxDoubleWide])

I'd rather have you
 ([BassPulseThick] + zurle tail])

⭐ OUTRO — DJ Friendly Balkan Fade

([Kick+BassOnly])
([TapanSoftRoll])
([FilterDown])
([VoxChopFade] – “blue… blue… blue…”])
([ZurleLowFilter] fading into silence])

---

# hardcore_pop - Blue Apartment_Hardcore_Pop_1
[DESCRIPTION]
A bright, energetic tech-bass club driver built around a rubbery, rolling bassline that bounces beneath crisp claps, snappy percs, and 1/8 hats with playful 1/16 fills. The groove stays tight, minimal, and dance-ready, powered by a pulsing low end and slick bass stabs that respond to the vocal. The lyrics become rhythmic hooks—“get away,” “great blue,” “blue apartment”—chopped, stuttered, and looped to create a catchy, flirtatious energy. Verses stay clean and upfront, supported by sparse percussion and warm low mids, while the drops explode with wobbling tech-bass phrases, vocal chops, and wide, punchy drums. Breaks strip back to airy textures and filtered bass before snapping back into full bounce. Mix emphasizes wide tops, punchy sub-60–110 Hz movement, playful vocal FX, and tight compression for a modern, festival-ready tech-house bounce that feels fun, sunny, and irresistibly groovy.

[LYRICS]
[GlobalMix–Tech Bass / Modern Tech House ~125–128 BPM. Kick: tight/punchy 60–90 Hz, short tail. Bass: rubbery, rolling tech-bass, LFO wobble, sidechain 6–8 dB. Claps bright 4–6 kHz. Hats: 1/8 pulse + 1/16 fills. Perc: clicks, snaps, tom flicks. Stabs: bass stabs syncopated. Vox: clean male lead, forward, dry in verses; chopped, stuttered, and delayed in drops. FX: risers, white-noise lifts, pitch-downs, reverse breaths. Master: -6.5 LUFS, wide.]

⭐ DJ INTRO — Vocal Chop Hook (16 bars)

([VoxChop1/8] – “great blue… blue… blue…”)
([BassFilterLPF] – rolling bass teasing)
([TickPerc] – percussive snaps)
([HatSoft] – 1/8 with slight swing)

⭐ GROOVE LOOP A — Tech-Bass Bounce

([VoxLoop] – “get away… get away…”)
([BassOpen] – filter opening over 16 bars)
([PercClick] – cheeky offbeats)

([VoxDelayShort] – “blue” accents)

⭐ VERSE 1 — Clean, Upfront, Minimal Behind It

I've got some plans for us
 ([VoxCloseDry])

All those days in the city
 ([HatGhost1/16])

Got the best of us
 ([BassHintLPF])

And we're all wearing down
 ([PadSmallAir] – very light)

Could use some time in a bed in a quiet town
 ([PercSoft])

Some time alone with you
 ([VoxWarmMono])

Got a couple ideas that we could get up to
 ([ReverseBreathFX])

Some things we could get down on
 ([BassPulse])

So let's blow this joint
 ([SnareLiftSoft])

Leave behind this town for the
 ([VoxDelay1/8D])

Great blue
 ([VoxChopSmall] – “great… great… blue”)

All that we've been through
 ([BassTease])

Seems like we could use some time away
 ([PadThin])

All of the lies that were so true
 ([PercSnap])

Would you like to
 ([VoxReverseLead])

Get away
 ([BuildPerc1/4])

For the night
 ([SnareRoll1/8])

In the great blue
 ([SilenceCue] – 1 beat before drop)

⭐ DROP 1 — Main Tech-Bass Groove

([BassFull] – wobble tech-bass, rubbery, sidechained)
([ClapWide])
([OpenHat])
([StabBass1/4] – syncopated stabs)

([VoxChopHook] – “get away… get away… blue… blue…”])
([VoxStutter] – “apartment… apart-apartment”])

⭐ CHORUS — Over Drop Groove (Tech-House Style)

I've got a blue apartment
 ([VoxFront])
And I'm feelin' blue
 ([SlapDelayShort])

A blue apartment
 ([VoxDoubleWide])
I'd rather have you
 ([BassStabResponse])

⭐ BREAK — Airy + Filtered Bass

([BassLPF] – lowpassed bounce)
([PadAirWide])
([VoxSpokenLow] – “get away with me…”)
([HatDropOut])

([VoxReverseChop] – “blue… blue… blue…”))

⭐ VERSE 2 — Chill but Still Groovy

Baby
 ([VoxCloseDry])

We could sleep in
 ([PercSoft])

Maybe wake up to birds
 ([PadLight])

Hear them sing again
 ([HatGhost])

Drink some coffee outside
 ([BassHintLPF])

With no traffic in sight
 ([PercClickWide])

With no rush to arrive
 ([VoxDelayShort])

With not a single plan
 ([PadThin])

Just the will of our hearts and the works of our hands
 ([ReverseBreathFX])

To make something beautiful
 ([BassPulseMid])

To leave behind our past
 ([PercRise])

Live in
 ([SnareLift])

The blue
 ([VoxStutter] – “blue-blue-blue”])

All that we've been through
 ([PadSwellSmall])

Seems like we could use some time away
 ([HatAdd1/16])

All of the lies that were so true
 ([PercSnap])

Would you like to
 ([VoxReverseLead])

Get away
 ([MiniBuild])

For the night
 ([SnareRoll1/8→1/16])

In the great blue
 ([SilenceCue])

⭐ DROP 2 — Bigger, Bouncier, More Vocal Chops

([BassGrowlBright])
([HatOpenHigher])
([ClapThicker])

([VoxMegaChop] – “great blue… get away… blue apartment… you… you… you…”])
([BassStabAnswer] – answering each vocal hit])

([ReverbThrow] – “blue” into air])

⭐ CHORUS REPRISE

I've got a blue apartment
 ([VoxFront])
And I'm feelin' blue
 ([SlapDelay])

A blue apartment
 ([VoxDoubleWide])
I'd rather have you
 ([BassPulseThick])

⭐ OUTRO — DJ Friendly

([Kick+BassOnly])
([FilterDown])
([VoxChopFade] – “blue… blue… blue…”])

# hardcore_pop - Blue Apartment_Hardcore_Pop_1
[DESCRIPTION]
A bright, energetic tech-bass club driver built around a rubbery, rolling bassline that bounces beneath crisp claps, snappy percs, and 1/8 hats with playful 1/16 fills. The groove stays tight, minimal, and dance-ready, powered by a pulsing low end and slick bass stabs that respond to the vocal. Breaks strip back to airy textures and filtered bass before snapping back into full bounce. Mix emphasizes wide tops, punchy sub-60–110 Hz movement, playful vocal FX, and tight compression for a modern, festival-ready tech-house bounce that feels fun, sunny, and irresistibly groovy.

[LYRICS]
[GlobalMix–Tech Bass / Modern Tech House ~125–128 BPM. Kick: tight/punchy 60–90 Hz, short tail. Bass: rubbery, rolling tech-bass, LFO wobble, sidechain 6–8 dB. Claps bright 4–6 kHz. [DESCRIPTION]

Heavy tapan rolls and tight darbuka fills drive a frantic rhythmic undercurrent beneath a grunting mid-bass wobble glued to a deep, wide sub. ([TapanSoftRoll])
([FilterDown])
([VoxChopFade] – “blue… blue… blue…”])
([ZurleLowFilter] fading into silence])

---

# hardcore_pop - Bounccy_ Hardcore_Pop_2
[DESCRIPTION]
A hypnotic tech house groove pulses with tight bass and crisp, driving percussion, while moody, underground club ambiences set the scene. Siren-style risers and chopped rave samples slice in atop bass that morphs subtly throughout. 80s-inspired midi synths layer melodic hooks, and sampled crowd cheers and chant vocals explode with raw, communal energy at each drop.

# hardcore_pop - bryyyalica gnlu slepars_Hardcore_Pop_3
[DESCRIPTION]
At 128 bpm pulsating club tech track , zurle, organ,80s midi synths, car siren,hypnotic, sultry reggaeton vibes, tire screeching, dynamic, dance non-stop groove paired with silk smooth voices, no autotune, just clear vocals

[Verse 1]
([808 sub-drop] - boooom)
tajm black,gole njene grudi
([Female BV, breathy] - aaah)
Gori štek purim ona nek’ me ljubi
([Hi-hat roll] - tktktk)
ona ta zna da nešto mutim
([Vocal chop, pitched] - "mutim, mutim")

da tvoj sam bio

nikad nisam krio da

ona k’o mafiosa
([Female BV] - mmm)
ra-rabiosa
([Stutter FX] - "ra-ra-rabiosa")
a alkohol je kida sad
([Bottle clink] - clink)
ona gola i ja sam
rabiosa,ra-rabiosa
([Stereo delay] - "biosa… osa…")

oo-oh aa-ah
([Female BV, layered] - aaah-aaaah)
svašta bih radio sad
([Ad-lib] - "sve, sve")

a ja bih zbog nje zapalio grad

([Filter sweep down] - fwooom)

# hardcore_pop - Ccenter_Hardcore_Pop_2
[DESCRIPTION]
The Serbian drill track opens at 100 BPM: deep, muffled kicks, distant snare/clap, sparse hats, and long sub notes set an ominous mood. Shakers and tighter hats build, with off-beat percussive synth stabs introducing a 90s Euro-reggae pop bounce. Rising to 135 BPM, sliding 808s and clipped, distorted bass hit with aggressive, stuttering hats and punchy percussion for peak intensity. Sparse, sharp melodic hooks cut through, while rapid, processed crew vocals trade off for a menacing texture. The outro strips to airy hats and a clean clap, shifting toward a lighter, hopeful feel.

[LYRICS]
[Verse 1]
I don't get lonely being alone
Lost in my own time zones
And though I don't know where I call home
I'm centered in my bones

[Prechorus]
And oh
Though I haven't always known

[Chorus]
I am center
Center

[Verse 2]
Getting lost was part of the game
Right place
Wrong time
Was just my pace
And though you may not understand
I'm here and ready to expand

[Prechorus]
And oh
I didn't always know

[Chorus]
I am center
Center

[Verse]
I sit alone
In silence
But I'm not lonely
I have my guidance
I see a person
In the mirror
And she is someone
I hold dearer

[Chorus]
I'm on my own
And I don't mind it
'Cause I know myself
And I don't fight it

[Verse 2]
I'm with myself
On the horizon
In my reflection
I find my guidance
I walk alone
But I'm not lonely
The only person
I know is the one and only

[Chorus]
I'm on my own
And I don't mind it
'Cause I know myself
And I don't fight it

[Bridge]
And every road
Leads home again
My path is mine
And mine alone

[Chorus]
I'm on my own
And I don't mind it
'Cause I know myself
And I don't fight it

---

# hardcore_pop - Ccenter_Hardcore_Pop_2
[DESCRIPTION]
The Serbian drill track opens at 100 BPM: deep, muffled kicks, distant snare/clap, sparse hats, and long sub notes set an ominous mood. Shakers and tighter hats build, with off-beat percussive synth stabs introducing a 90s Euro-reggae pop bounce. Rising to 135 BPM, sliding 808s and clipped, distorted bass hit with aggressive, stuttering hats and punchy percussion for peak intensity. Sparse, sharp melodic hooks cut through, while rapid, processed crew vocals trade off for a menacing texture. The outro strips to airy hats and a clean clap, shifting toward a lighter, hopeful feel.

[LYRICS]
[Verse 1]
I don't get lonely being alone
Lost in my own time zones
And though I don't know where I call home
I'm centered in my bones

[Prechorus]
And oh
Though I haven't always known

[Chorus]
I am center
Center

[Verse 2]
Getting lost was part of the game
Right place
Wrong time
Was just my pace
And though you may not understand
I'm here and ready to expand

[Prechorus]
And oh
I didn't always know

[Chorus]

Center

[Verse]
I sit alone
In silence
But I'm not lonely

I see a person
In the mirror
And she is someone
I hold dearer

[Chorus]
I'm on my own
And I don't mind it
'Cause I know myself
And I don't fight it

[Verse 2]
I'm with myself
On the horizon
In my reflection
I find my guidance
I walk alone
But I'm not lonely
The only person
I know is the one and only

[Chorus]
I'm on my own
And I don't mind it
'Cause I know myself
And I don't fight it

[Bridge]
And every road
Leads home again
My path is mine
And mine alone

[Chorus]
I'm on my own
And I don't mind it
'Cause I know myself
And I don't fight it

# hardcore_pop - Ccenter_Hardcore_Pop_4
[DESCRIPTION]
bouncy undeground slap club tech Balkan oriental pop ,  car honks, tire screeching, dynamic, dance non-stop groove paired with silk smooth voices, no autotune, just clear vocals

[LYRICS]
[Mix/Master – Verse: Bouncy underground slap-club tech groove ~124–128 BPM. Tight, punchy kick and short subby bass with fast sidechain for “pumping” feel. Perc loops built from light Balkan percussion + occasional car honks and tire-screech FX as fills, tucked but audible in the sides. Oriental plucks/keys midrange, leaving space for vocal. Lead vocal silky, clear, zero autotune, light compression and de-essing, gentle high-shelf for air. Short plate reverb and tight slap delay, mostly mono-focused, with natural doubles in choruses. Overall mix warm, upfront, and very dance-floor ready.]

[Verse] With you
Baby
All night
I could do that
I'm on your Wi-Fi
We don't need no router
Turn the phone off

I don't know how to act

[Mix/Master – Chorus: Same groove but with extra lift: 0.5–1 dB louder into the bus, wider stereo from added Balkan/oriental hooks and crowd-style claps. Car honks and tire-screech FX answer key phrases, automated up slightly at bar turns. Drum bus with a bit more parallel compression for slam, but low end kept tight and controlled. Lead vocal still clean, no autotune, slightly thicker with natural doubles and gentle stereo spread. Backing stacks soft and silky, slightly darker to sit behind lead. Reverb tail a touch longer for “anthem” feel, but still club-tight. Master: warm glue comp, soft clipper catching peaks, transparent limiter for solid club loudness without harshness.]

# hardcore_pop - Ccharlatan_Hardcore_Pop_1
[DESCRIPTION]
An 129 bpm  house track , zurna, organ,80s synth, cowbells, ancient harp, car siren, tire screeching, dynamic, dance non-stop groove paired with silk smooth voices, no autotune, just clear vocals. minor/Dorian. Male: smooth, deep, rhythmic, sits in the groove; Female: airy, whispery, dreamy, rides the top. Both laid-back with syncopated phrasing; subtle plate & ping-pong delays; presence lift 3–5 kHz, air 10–12 kHz; never overpower the beat.

[LYRICS]
[Verse]
[Male] I'm a charlatan with charm [Female - (mmm, charm)]

# hardcore_pop - Ccheckpoint_Hardcore_Pop_1
[DESCRIPTION]
A dybamic, 134 bpm slap hypnotic underground house track , zurna, organ,80s synth, cowbells, ancient harp, car siren, tire screeching, dynamic, dance non-stop groove paired with silk smooth voices, no autotune, just clear vocals,

[LYRICS]
[Verse]
Out the driveway and hit the highway
([Engine start] - vrrr-vrrroom)
Tires hit the gravel
([Tire crunch] - krsh-krsh)
60 miles
([Road hum] - mmmmmm)
And we in it
([Sub pulse] - thumm)
Pedal to the metal
([Pedal stomp] - thud)
We drive fast
([Gear shift] - chk)
Live fast
([Wind rush] - whoooosh)
[?] ticket
([Siren tease distant] - nee~naw)
On the ride of our lives
([Bass lift] - wub-wub)
And we in it
([Crowd whoop] - ayyyo)

[Prechorus]
Took a wrong turn
([Indicator tick] - tik-tik)
Take a detour
([GPS beep] - bip)
Backtrack
([Tire skid soft] - skrrp)
That's another 40 miles
([Odometer roll] - drrr)
And we in it
([Kick hit] - boom)
Siri says to go left
([Siri blip] - bling)
GPS says right
([Recalc beep] - beep-beep)
That's another 20 miles
([Highway hum] - mmmmmm)
And we in it
([Reverse sweep] - whooom)

[Chorus]
When the party's in the ride
([Car bass rumble] - wub-wub)
We ain't gotta arrive
([Crowd murmur] - mmmrum)
Another checkpoint
([Toll beep] - bip)
That's another 40 miles
([Rolling tires] - rrrrrr)
And we in it
([Handclap] - clap)
Another checkpoint
([Sign whoosh] - fffsh)
That's another 20 miles
([Kick + snap] - boom-snap)
And we in it
([Vocal chop] - ah-eh)

When the party's in the ride
([Interior reverb] - ooo)
We ain't gotta arrive
([Laugh exhale] - haaah)
Another checkpoint
([Turn signal] - tik-tik)
That's another 40 miles

# hardcore_pop - Chips in the Oven_Hardcore_Pop_1
[DESCRIPTION]
An 135-140 bpm uk organ bassline charva hypnotic underground house track , zurna, organ,80s synth, cowbells, ancient harp, car siren, tire screeching, dynamic, dance non-stop groove paired with silk smooth voices, no autotune, just clear vocals, powerful beat

[LYRICS]
[Verse]
My mate from work
She swears to God
He’s a sound lad
Just misunderstood
It’s probably true
And maybe he is
But that doesn’t change what he did
So I can’t be havin’ it

[Verse]
And my mate at the bar says
“If you’re in the mood
I know someone who’d be perfect for you”
And maybe it’s true
But you know what I’m like
I’ve got chips in the oven and it’s Friday night
I’ll just go out with the girls tonight

[Verse]
And my mate who does my hair
She says
“That lad
I can’t believe you fell for that”
And she’s probably right
I don’t know what I was thinkin’
But I’ll be in your bed when you’re just gettin’ in
And we’ll get back together again

[Bridge]
I need someone to keep me in check
But I need someone who can put me in check
Someone who’ll get on with my friends
Someone who can put me in check

[Chorus]
My friend who does my hair says
“Oh my God
How can you like him when he is such a knob?”
And I said
“It’s true
But you know what I’m like
I’ve got chips in the oven and it’s Friday night
I’ll just go out with the girls tonight”

# hardcore_pop - Dama_sa_Tempom_Hardcore_Pop
[DESCRIPTION]
A hypnotic tech house track at 134 BPM, anchored by a deep, dubbed-out bassline and minimal percussion—rimshots, tambourine, scattered cowbell—offset by warm analog pads for an immersive yet danceable mood. Organic hand drums, wooden blocks, bell trees, and beach party field recordings layer human and atmospheric texture. Detuned FM arpeggios propel fluid melodic motion. The breakdown showcases isolated bass and airy vocal loops, then builds with additional percussion. The drop unveils a punchy 909 kick and tight hi-hats, while occasional saturated, reverby chord stabs add character. Space, subtlety, and groove guide the arrangement for seamless DJ mixing.

[LYRICS]
[Male]
Ja
Ja
Ja
Ja
Ja
Svi mi ovde znamo šta je šta
Ko je gde i ko je šta
Ko je taj i ko je ta
Ko to skače- kao ja?

[Female]
Here we go
Again
I know a place where we can dance
Don't act like you don't understand
Now is your chance to go all night (Oh, oh, oh)
I got you wonderin' why
Let's make this party never end
And we can do it again and again and again

[Male]
A u klubu (a-ha) svetla gore, svi su tu,
Ruke traže ruke, ljubav kruži tu.
Kao da smo mi — ooh, yeah — za ples i san rođeni,
Večeras možda sija grad, možda došao i taj dan.

(S tobom bi sve odjednom)

# hardcore_pop - Dama_sa_Tempom_Hardcore_Pop_11
[DESCRIPTION]
Morphing sub-bass merges West Coast Moog slides with jungle ritualistic depth at 145 BPM. Snappy syncopated percussion layers 808 rim shots over tribal drum programming. Ambient club noise blends hydraulic sounds and distant conversations. Siren risers combine with talk box vocoder phrases during buildup. 80s-inspired midi synths deliver whining funk leads with heavy vibrato. Rave samples punctuate transitions alongside Parliament-influenced flute whistles. Drops unleash crowd roars mixed with layered gang vocals and chopped fertility chant fragments. Punchy vocals processed through formant shifting create alien textures. Tighter groove emphasizes dembow-influenced syncopation within four-on-floor structure. Pulsing hypnotic energy maintained through portamento bassline glides and vintage synth triangle waves. Atmospheric depth includes lowrider references and ceremonial bell tones. Breakdown strips to bass and finger snaps before full arrangement returns. Production balances analog wa

Ko je taj i ko je ta
Ko to skače- kao ja?

# hardcore_pop - Dama_sa_Tempom_Hardcore_Pop_11
[DESCRIPTION]
Morphing sub-bass merges West Coast Moog slides with jungle ritualistic depth at 145 BPM. Snappy syncopated percussion layers 808 rim shots over tribal drum programming. Ambient club noise blends hydraulic sounds and distant conversations. Siren risers combine with talk box vocoder phrases during buildup. 80s-inspired midi synths deliver whining funk leads with heavy vibrato. Rave samples punctuate transitions alongside Parliament-influenced flute whistles. Drops unleash crowd roars mixed with layered gang vocals and chopped fertility chant fragments. Punchy vocals processed through formant shifting create alien textures. Tighter groove emphasizes dembow-influenced syncopation within four-on-floor structure. Pulsing hypnotic energy maintained through portamento bassline glides and vintage synth triangle waves. Atmospheric depth includes lowrider references and ceremonial bell tones. Breakdown strips to bass and finger snaps before full arrangement returns. Production balances analog wa

# hardcore_pop - Dama_sa_Tempom_Hardcore_Pop_11
[DESCRIPTION]
This EDM banger erupts at 150 BPM,igniting the floor with a relentless fusion of Balkan soul and modern fury. It opens with the iconic,wailing cry of a traditional accordion sample,immediately hijacked by a pounding,4/4 kick drum that feels like a heartbeat on steroids. The original melancholic melody is twisted into a weaponized synth lead,soaring over a seismic,sidechained bassline that never relents. Fiery Balkan brass stabs,processed through distortion and delay,punch through the mix like gunshots,while the original vocal—pitched and glitched—becomes a defiant,robotic mantra commanding you to move. There are no breakdowns,only momentary breathers where the kick filters back in with more punishing force. This is a non-stop,percussive assault designed for pure,unadulterated chaos; a track that doesn't build to a drop,but rather IS the drop from start to finish. It's a timeless melody supercharged into a futuristic,unrelenting beast that grabs you by the soul and refuses to let go u

# hardcore_pop - Dama_sa_Tempom_Hardcore_Pop_12 (1.34x)
[DESCRIPTION]
A 150 BPM slap EDM banger, fusing Balkan soul with modern force. Opens with a wailing accordion sample, overtaken by punishing 4/4 kicks. Twisted synth leads echo a timeless melody over seismic, sidechained bass. Distorted Balkan brass stabs slice through, glitched vocals bark commands, and relentless percussion drives a constant high—a floor-filling track that never lets up or breaks, only grows heavier with brief filtered kicks and explosive drops woven throughout.

[LYRICS]
[Intro—0:00–0:18—crowd ignition]
[ARR:club crowd FX fade-in;accordion sample filtered LP 400→8k;snare roll 1/8 build;kick muted 4 bars then full entry;vocal chops LCR pingpong;]
[PROC:pad stereo widen 15%;kick comp 2:1;HPF intro below 60Hz;short delay 1/8th sync;auto-pan brass +10%]
([BACK:whispered crowd chant “Ajde! Ajde!” hard-pan L/R, delay tail 1/4])

[Male—0:18–0:34—swagger entry]
Ja
Ja
Ja
Ja
Ja
Svi mi ovde znamo šta je šta
Ko je gde i ko je šta
Ko je taj i ko je ta
Ko to skače — kao ja?
([BACK:group echo “kao ja!” “kao ja!” stereo pingpong, 30% wet])

[Female—0:34–0:56—bounce lift]
Here we go
Again
I know a place where we can dance
Don't act like you don't understand
Now is your chance to go all night (Oh, oh, oh)
I got you wonderin’ why
Let’s make this party never end
And we can do it again and again and again
([BACK:female harmony “again, again” reverb 2.8s, 15% pitch detune L])

[Build—0:56–1:12—energy surge]
[ARR:add slap bass synth;hi-hat 1/16 open swing;brass stab riser 2 bars;FX whoosh reversed;vocal stutter “ja-ja-ja” gate rhythmically;]
[PROC:sidechain all pads↔kick;compress synth bus 2.5:1;delay 1/4 pingpong;add 2dB transient snap snare]
([BACK:male chant “aj, aj, aj!” under snare rolls])

[Drop 1—1:12–1:44—club explosion]
[ARR:kick full + sub 50Hz;accordion chopped to 1/8 notes;zurna stab syncopated;lead synth detuned mono;female shout layers on beat 2;]
[PROC:master bus +1.5dB;limiter ceiling -0.3dB;distortion send 12%;reverb tail brass short plate]

[PRODUCTION & MIX TIPS:keep 32-bar phrasing;sidechain reverb sends to avoid smear;automate accordion filter open on drops;layer zurna one octave higher with brass;vocal delay <25%;maintain kick-brass balance;test in mono <100Hz.]

# hardcore_pop - Dama_sa_Tempom_Hardcore_Pop_13
[DESCRIPTION]
Slap house(155BPM):Saturated 808 sub@45Hz+harm excite.Syncopated kick layers+sidechain 4:1/20ms attack.TB-303 acid saw+res sweep 30-85%+LFO 1/16sync.Hypnotic vox"padam boj nespokoj"autotune+tape delay 1/8dot.Triplet hats 16%swing+relentless groove.White noise risers+rev cymbals.Build(150→155BPM/16b):Acid chromatic rise+tube sat.Percussion fills+offbeat claps.BG vox"ona kush mi sushi"±12st+chorus.Drop(155BPM/32b):24-layer spectrum.FM perc 2:1+3.5:1 alt L/R.Acid mirror+octave displacement.Call-response"gle sata gle kola"spatial movement.Tape A800 saturation+opto comp 3:1.Break(145BPM/16b):Notch 80-200Hz+stereo narrow 40%.Rev piano maj7+cathedral verb.Sparse claps.Choir chops granular.Outro(155→140BPM/32b):Sequential dropout.Acid→sine sub mono<80Hz.Final vox"pala sve moje testove"granular 150ms+LP fade 2k→200Hz exp.

[
💿 Result: A 155 BPM slap house duet—electrified chemistry of male Serbian swagger and female pop seduction. Acid bass grooves twist with auto-tuned calls, voices flipping between tension and tease. Every build breathes anticipation; every drop feels like motion caught between lust, rhythm, and pure voltage.]

# hardcore_pop - Dama_sa_Tempom_Hardcore_Pop_15
[DESCRIPTION]
This 150 BPM Balkan-EDM hybrid ignites the dancefloor from first note. Zurne wails cut through pounding 4/4 kicks and sidechained subs. The original melancholic melody is twisted into a glitched, robotic synth lead, soaring over seismic bass. Fiery distorted brass stabs and processed vocal chops create a relentless, non-stop percussive assault. Momentary filtered-kick breaths allow short relief, but the energy never drops. Granular vocal manipulation, pitch shifts, and stereo FX give depth and chaos. The track blends traditional Balkan soul with modern EDM fury, designed as a continuous, unrelenting floor-dominating weapon with maximum DJ mixability and instant crowd impact.

# hardcore_pop - Dama_sa_Tempom_Hardcore_Pop_17
[DESCRIPTION]
This EDM banger erupts at 150 BPM,igniting the floor with a relentless fusion of Balkan soul and modern fury. It opens with the iconic,wailing cry of a traditional accordion sample,immediately hijacked by a pounding,4/4 kick drum that feels like a heartbeat on steroids. The original melancholic melody is twisted into a weaponized synth lead,soaring over a seismic,sidechained bassline that never relents. Fiery Balkan brass stabs,processed through distortion and delay,punch through the mix like gunshots,while the original vocal—pitched and glitched—becomes a defiant,robotic mantra commanding you to move. There are no breakdowns,only momentary breathers where the kick filters back in with more punishing force. This is a non-stop,percussive assault designed for pure,unadulterated chaos; a track that doesn't build to a drop,but rather IS the drop from start to finish. It's a timeless melody supercharged into a futuristic,unrelenting beast that grabs you by the soul and refuses to let go u

# hardcore_pop - Dama_sa_Tempom_Hardcore_Pop_17
[DESCRIPTION]
This EDM banger erupts at 150 BPM,igniting the floor with a relentless fusion of Balkan soul and modern fury. It opens with the iconic,wailing cry of a traditional accordion sample,immediately hijacked by a pounding,4/4 kick drum that feels like a heartbeat on steroids. The original melancholic melody is twisted into a weaponized synth lead,soaring over a seismic,sidechained bassline that never relents. Fiery Balkan brass stabs,processed through distortion and delay,punch through the mix like gunshots,while the original vocal—pitched and glitched—becomes a defiant,robotic mantra commanding you to move. There are no breakdowns,only momentary breathers where the kick filters back in with more punishing force. This is a non-stop,percussive assault designed for pure,unadulterated chaos; a track that doesn't build to a drop,but rather IS the drop from start to finish. It's a timeless melody supercharged into a futuristic,unrelenting beast that grabs you by the soul and refuses to let go u

[LYRICS]
[Male]
Ja
Ja
Ja
Ja
Ja
Svi mi ovde znamo šta je šta
Ko je gde i ko je šta
Ko je taj i ko je ta
Ko to skače- kao ja?

[Female]

I got you wonderin' why
Let's make this party never end
And we can do it again and again and again

# hardcore_pop - Dama_sa_Tempom_Hardcore_Pop_18
[DESCRIPTION]
This 150 BPM electronic powerhouse opens with pounding distorted sub-bass and a mechanical four-on-the-floor kick. Syncopated stabs and searing percussion weave shifting polyrhythms, while chopped vocals layer rhythmic texture. Structure advances through evolving percussion, filtered morphing, modulated bass timbre, and flickering pads—building sustained intensity with no breaks, maximizing impact on colossal outdoor sound systems for all-out bodily immersion.

# hardcore_pop - Dama_sa_Tempom_Hardcore_Pop_19
[DESCRIPTION]
This tech house track surges at 133bpm, launching with a morphing deep bassline, syncopated percussion, and filtered club noise. Siren risers and rave stabs heighten tension as 80s MIDI synth hooks drive the buildup. Jungle ambience, organic drums, zurne, and cathedral organ textures layer in. The drop explodes with crowd roars, chopped chant samples, and intricate polyrhythms, keeping relentless, communal dancefloor energy at its peak.

# hardcore_pop - Dama_sa_Tempom_Hardcore_Pop_6
[DESCRIPTION]
A 144 BPM hybrid slams G-funk swagger into relentless EDM framework: whining Moog bassline with portamento glides over minor seventh funk changes meets razor-sidechained synth bass, vintage triangle-wave synths vibrato-rich collide with distorted Balkan stabs cutting midrange, talk box vocoder hooks and glitched pitch-shifted vocal chops form dual robotic mantras, four-on-floor kick with transient shaping (fast attack, 140ms release) drives 808 rim shots and crisp house claps, ghosted two-four snares create shuffle against tight 16/8 phrasing, Flute whistles and hydraulic siren atmospherics layer with white-noise punches and reverse synth pre-hits, No full breakdowns—filtered kick micro-drops strip to bass and snaps before slamming back with gang vocals and synth stabs, aggressive sidechain 5:1 adds bouncy pocket, analog tape warmth meets LFO-warped wavetable bass, tempo-synced gated reverb on vocal chops, MIX: mono sub <120Hz, stereo widen 4–10k, glue bus 1.4:1, notch 200–380Hz, multi

# hardcore_pop - Dama_sa_Tempom_Hardcore_Pop_9
[DESCRIPTION]
150 BPM EDM weapon opening with zurle wail locked to relentless 4/4 kick and razor-sidechained bass. Distorted Balkan stabs slice midrange; glitched pitch-shifted vocal becomes robotic hook-mantra. Zero breakdowns—filtered kick micro-drops cut/slam harder. Contemporary pop-electronic fusion maintains Balkan melodic core. Production: transient-shaped kick (fast attack, 140ms release), multiband distortion on stabs, LFO-warped wavetable bass, tempo-synced gated reverb on vocal chops. Mix: mono sub <120Hz, aggressive sidechain 6:1, stereo widen 4-10kHz, glue bus 4:1, notch 200-380Hz mud-clear. Arrangement: tight 16/8 phrasing, DJ-ready 8/16-bar chant loops, clear intro/outro, tempo-mapped harmonic mixing. FX: reverse zurle pre-hits, white-noise punches, short crowd risers. Technical specs: intro (0:00), beat drop (0:30), bridge build (2:10). Export: 24-bit/48kHz WAV stems labeled BPM/key, -6 LUFS club master, -9 LUFS promo, 90s radio edit, dry vocal stem. QC: phase-check, mono-sum test, c

# hardcore_pop - Dama_sa_Tempom_Hardcore_Pop_9
[DESCRIPTION]
150 BPM EDM weapon opening with zurle wail locked to relentless 4/4 kick and razor-sidechained bass. Distorted Balkan stabs slice midrange; glitched pitch-shifted vocal becomes robotic hook-mantra. Zero breakdowns—filtered kick micro-drops cut/slam harder. Contemporary pop-electronic fusion maintains Balkan melodic core. Production: transient-shaped kick (fast attack, 140ms release), multiband distortion on stabs, LFO-warped wavetable bass, tempo-synced gated reverb on vocal chops. Mix: mono sub <120Hz, aggressive sidechain 6:1, stereo widen 4-10kHz, glue bus 4:1, notch 200-380Hz mud-clear. Arrangement: tight 16/8 phrasing, DJ-ready 8/16-bar chant loops, clear intro/outro, tempo-mapped harmonic mixing. FX: reverse zurle pre-hits, white-noise punches, short crowd risers. Technical specs: intro (0:00), beat drop (0:30), bridge build (2:10). Export: 24-bit/48kHz WAV stems labeled BPM/key, -6 LUFS club master, -9 LUFS promo, 90s radio edit, dry vocal stem. QC: phase-check, mono-sum test, c

[LYRICS]
[Male]

Ja

Ko je taj i ko je ta
Ko to skače- kao ja?

# hardcore_pop - Dirty_Bass_Hardcore_Pop_1
[DESCRIPTION]
An underground slap tech house track , zurle, organ,car siren, tire screeching, dynamic, dance non-stop groove paired with silk smooth voices, no autotune, just clear vocals

[LYRICS]
[Male]
Pulse like thunder, fierce in sight
([Traffic hum / distant city] - mmmmmmrum)
Take what's mine tonight
([Engine rev] - vrrrroom)
No words, just skin
([Breath exhale] - haaah)
Let the chaos begin
([Vinyl crackle / static] - pftcrackle)

[Female]
Harder, faster, lose your mind
([Kick hit / boom] - boom)
Leave your conscience behind
([Air hiss] - psssshh)
Sweat and sin on the floor
([Crowd murmur / cheer] - ayyyo)
Give me what I came here for
([Horn short honk] - honk)

[Female]
Dirty bass, dirty games
([Sub-bass rumble] - rrrrrr)
Set my body up in flames
([Fire crackle] - tsss)
Don't stop, don't think
([Snare tick] - tchk)
Push me to the brink
([Tire screech] - skreeeech)

[Female]
Deeper, rougher, make me scream
([Engine idle rumble] - rrrrrr)
Nothing's ever what it seems
([Echo sweep] - whooom)
Raw desire, pure control
([Metal scrape / tension] - shrrrk)
Come and take my fucking soul
([Glass crack / impact] - krack)

[Female and Male]
No mercy, no escape
([Siren distant] - teenooneenoo)
This is how we dominate
([Sub pulse / dum] - thumm)
When the beat drops, we collide
([Reverse crash] - whoooosh)
Nothing left but sweat and pride
([Heartbeat / thump] - thumpthump)

[Outro]
Bass cuts deep, hearts race fast
([Bass wobble] - wubwub)
Make this dirty moment last
([Vinyl tail / pftcrackle] - pftcrackle)

[Male]
Cut the lights, feel the heat
([Switch click] - klik)
Move your body to this beat
([Kick groove] - boom-boom)
No games, just raw desire
([Sub growl] - grrrr)
Set this fucking floor on fire
([Glass shatter hit] - krashh)

[Male]
Bass line crawling up your spine
([Low hum / mmmmmmrum] - mmmmmmrum)
Tonight you're fucking mine
([Breath inhale / close] - haaah)

[Female]
Hands up, lose yourself
([Footsteps soft / tap] - tapptap)
Put your shame back on the shelf
([Cloth rustle] - ffffsh)
Hard beats, harder touch
([Snare roll] - tchk-tchk)
Give me everything you've got
([Coin drop / cling] - cling)

[Pre-Chorus]
Acid burns through every thought
([High hiss / acid sweep] - ssssh)
Take the high that can't be bought
([Vinyl stab] - pft)

[Call and Response]
*Male:* "Tell me what you want"
([Two-way murmur] - bzzztch)
*Female:* "Everything and more"
([Whisper echo] - whoooh)
*Male:* "Show me how you move"
([Sub hit] - thumm)
*Female:* "Like a dirty whore"
([Shout / callout] - ayyyo)

[Breakdown:]
*Both (whispered/autotuned):*
Deeper... deeper... lose control
([Deep sub rumble] - rrrrrr)
Harder... harder... sell your soul
([Kick distortion] - boom-crk)
Faster... faster... feel the rush
([Clap FX] - tchk-tchk)
Nothing left but flesh and lust
([Breath exhale / long] - haaah)

[Final Hook (Both)]
When the sun comes up we're gone
([Reverse crash / fade] - whooom)
But tonight we're fucking strong
([Engine rev / surge] - vrrrroom)
Bass and sweat and skin collide
([Vinyl pop / pft] - pft)
This is how we come alive
([Crowd cheer / climax] - ayyyo)

# hardcore_pop - Don't be stranger- Hardcore_Pop_1
[DESCRIPTION]
bouny undeground slap club tech Turkish oriental pop ,  car honks, tire screeching, dynamic, dance non-stop groove paired with silk smooth voices, no autotune, just clear vocals

[LYRICS]
[Verse]
I could talk to you in pictures
Let my fingers do the swipes
And if you want
I could describe what it is I did last night
If I get it in good lighting
It's just as good as in real life
And there's something 'bout that glow that gets me every single time

[Pre-Chorus]
But you feel so much better than the glass
And I hope that this won't be the last
[Chorus]
'Cause there's nothing like being with you
There's nothing like being with you
There's nothing like being with you
There's nothing like being with you

[Verse 2]
I know my inbox is demanding
My phone says that it's urgent
There's some paperwork I'm missing
Says the Amazon merchant
There's a small group chat I have with my old high school friends
I don't wanna leave you waiting
I don't wanna leave them on read

[Pre-Chorus]
But you feel so much better than the glass
And I hope that this won't be the last

[Chorus]
'Cause there's nothing like being with you
There's nothing like being with you
There's nothing like being with you
There's nothing like being with you
There's nothing like being with you
There's nothing like being with you
There's nothing like being with you
There's nothing like being with you
[Bridge]
And I know I can't ignore it
'Cause it's all I have to stay connected
And I don't wanna be foreign
But you can't send me a text and expect it to be enough
It just ain't enough
'cause it ain't the same

[Chorus]
There's nothing like being with you
There's nothing like being with you
There's nothing like being with you
There's nothing like being with you
There's nothing like being with you
There's nothing like being with you
There's nothing like being with you
There's nothing like being with you

# hardcore_pop - Don't be stranger- Hardcore_Pop_1
[DESCRIPTION]
bouny undeground slap club tech Turkish oriental pop ,  car honks, tire screeching, dynamic, dance non-stop groove paired with silk smooth voices, no autotune, just clear vocals

[Verse]

Let my fingers do the swipes
And if you want

And there's something 'bout that glow that gets me every single time

# hardcore_pop - dr_Mixall_Khans_L
[DESCRIPTION]
This 155 BPM slap house track pulses with forceful, saturated sub-bass and syncopated, punchy drums. Gritty acid synths lead the hook, cut by sharp violins weaving Arabic modal riffs. Autotuned deep vocals, crisp hi-hats, and sweeping risers amplify the relentless, pounding club energy.

[LYRICS]
Noćima vec sanjam, (kako me doziva aaa aaa)
Dok šapuće mi ime sa tim sjajem u očima
I ne znam dal je ona stvarna ( aaaa)
Il živi mi u snovima, ne znam al dobro znam da...

Svaki put kad ona tu je, zvezde padaju (paadajuuu)
U meni tad se vojske bude, da svetom vladaju
I kad mi pruža svoje ruke (Ruuuke)
Misli se nadaju, da ostaće mi tu zauvek gde se srca raduju

A ona samo zna da igra (uuuu aaaa)
Ništa ne govori (Šššš)
Dok pleše oko mene čekam kad ću 
Da izgorim (plamen)
Da spojimo se ko dva dima među zvezdama
Da zagrlim je čvrsto i nikad ne puštam

---

# hardcore_pop - dr_Mixall_Khans_L
[DESCRIPTION]
This 155 BPM slap house track pulses with forceful, saturated sub-bass and syncopated, punchy drums. Gritty acid synths lead the hook, cut by sharp violins weaving Arabic modal riffs. Autotuned deep vocals, crisp hi-hats, and sweeping risers amplify the relentless, pounding club energy.

[LYRICS]
Noćima vec sanjam, (kako me doziva aaa aaa)
Dok šapuće mi ime sa tim sjajem u očima
I ne znam dal je ona stvarna ( aaaa)
Il živi mi u snovima, ne znam al dobro znam da...

Svaki put kad ona tu je, zvezde padaju (paadajuuu)
U meni tad se vojske bude, da svetom vladaju
I kad mi pruža svoje ruke (Ruuuke)
Misli se nadaju, da ostaće mi tu zauvek gde se srca raduju

A ona samo zna da igra (uuuu aaaa)
Ništa ne govori (Šššš)
Dok pleše oko mene čekam kad ću 
Da izgorim (plamen)
Da spojimo se ko dva dima među zvezdama
Da zagrlim je čvrsto i nikad ne puštam

# hardcore_pop - dr_Mixall_Khans_LI
[DESCRIPTION]
This 155 BPM slap house track pulses with forceful, saturated sub-bass and syncopated, punchy drums. Gritty acid synths lead the hook, cut by sharp violins weaving Arabic modal riffs. Autotuned deep vocals, crisp hi-hats, and sweeping risers amplify the relentless, pounding club energy.

[LYRICS]
[Instrumental - mysterious, sexy]

[Male - Verse 1]
Noćima već sanjam, (kako me doziva aaa aaa)
Dok šapuće mi ime sa tim sjajem u očima
I ne znam dal je ona stvarna ( aaaa)
Il živi mi u snovima, ne znam al dobro znam da...

[Instrumental - Buildup Acid synth melody intensifies with violin Arabic riffs]

[Female - Chorus]
Svaki put kad on tu je, zvezde padaju (paadajuuu)
U tebi tad se vojske bude, da svetom vladaju
I kad mi pruža svoje ruke (Ruuuke)
Misli se nadaju, da ostaće mi tu zauvek gde se srca raduju

[Male - Verse 2]
A ona samo zna da igra (uuuu aaaa)
Ništa ne govori (Šššš)
Dok pleše oko mene čekam kad ću 
Da izgorim (plamen)

[Instrumental - Breakdown Violin melody takes lead with sub-bass pulsing underneath]

[Female - Chorus]
Da spojimo se ko dva dima među zvezdama
Da zagrli me čvrsto i nikad ne pušta...

[Male - Bridge]
(Srce kuca... kuca... kuca samo za nju)
(Oči gledam... gledam... gledam samo nju)

[Instrumental - Buildup]

[Female - Chorus]
Svaki put kad on tu je, zvezde padaju (paadajuuu)
U tebi tad se vojske bude, da svetom vladaju
I kad mi pruža svoje ruke (Ruuuke)
Misli se nadaju, da ostaće mi tu zauvek gde se srca raduju

[Male -Outro]
Da spojimo se ko dva dima među zvezdama (među zvezdamaaa)
Da zagrlim je čvrsto i nikad ne puštam (nikad ne puštam)

[Instrumental - Fade Out Acid synth melody fades with sub-bass pulsing]

---

# hardcore_pop - Dunyaaa- Hardcore_Pop_1
[DESCRIPTION]
A bouncy underground slap-club tech Turkish oriental pop track erupts with fast, syncopated electronic drums, thick pulsating bass, and serpentine arpeggiated synths weaving Turkish scales. Car honks and tire screeches punctuate fills and transitions, adding street attitude without ever drowning the vocal. Dynamic dance grooves power nonstop movement while silk-smooth, auto-tune-free vocals glide on top, crystal-clear and expressive, shaped only by tasteful compression, light saturation, tight plate reverb, and tempo-locked delays. Sparse, focused traditional elements (zurna/saz-like leads, oriental pads) sit inside a tight, modern mix with subtle effects, letting rhythm and melody reign through verse–chorus loops and explosive synth breaks. The sound must stay energetic, punchy, and club-ready at all times – never weak, low-energy, overly sentimental, ethereal, violin-heavy, Arabic-styled, melodramatic, or overacted.

[LYRICS]
**1) Lyrics with production instructions (adapted to your new description)**

[Intro – Fast, syncopated slap-club groove ~124–126 BPM, but heavily low-passed: only a muffled kick pulse and thick sub-bass rumble. Wide pads + soft organ holding Turkish-style minor chord, serpentine arp very quiet in the back. Car honks and distant tire screech FX panned wide, short and rhythmic. Crowd/room noise low. Energy is tense and hypnotic, not weak or sentimental.]
[Intro]
(Ay, ay, ay, ay, ay, ay, ay, ay)
(Ay, ay, ay, ay, ay, ay, ay, ay)
(Ay, ay, ay, ay, ay, ay, ay, ay)
(Ay, ay, ay, ay, ay, ay, ay, ay)
[Chants – stacked male/female unison “Ay”, tight, slightly saturated, short plate, in tempo with kick; no autotune, no overacting, just confident hype.]

[Verse 1 – Beat opens a bit: fast, syncopated electronic drums fully in, thick pulsating bass, serpentine arps with Turkish scales (no Arabic melisma). Traditional elements sparse: a simple saz/zurna-like lead phrase every 2 bars. Mix tight, dry-ish; subtle FX only between lines. Vocal up front, clear, no autotune.]
[Verse 1]
Kojom ulicom korakom u noći
[FX – tiny reverse sweep into first word, then dry; kick+bass lock groove under]
Mislim samo da li ćeš mi doći
(bg vox: low “da li ćeš mi doći” echo, panned wide)
I šta se to sa nama desilo
[Delay – short 1/8 delay tail on “desilo”, filtered; no big reverb, keep it punchy]

[Chorus – Drums hit harder, bass thicker, arps louder and more “serpentine”. Car honks and tire screeches punctuate bar transitions (1–2 per 4 bars), sidechained to kick. Pads widen. Vocals lightly doubled in the center, plus low stereo harmonies; still natural, no tuning artifacts.]
[Chorus]
Svoje misli puštam dalje
(bg: soft “dalje, dalje” whisper L/R)
Kad tebi svoju ljubav šaljem
[Delay – 1/4 stereo delay on “šaljem”, low in mix]
Da te vratim sve od sebe dajem
[kick+bass accent this bar; subtle riser into next section]

[Verse 2 – Energy stays high but hats slightly tamed for space. Arpeggiated synth snakes between lines, Turkish scale fragments, not too busy. Occasional short honk hits and glitchy percussive fills, but never sentimental or ethereal.]
[Verse 2]
Hajde mala jednom reci mi
(bg: quiet “reci mi, reci mi” chopped]
Šta je tako posebno na tebi
[FX – brief tonal riser (synth, not strings) into “posebno”]
I kakvo ti to zlato na licu sija
[short bright synth sparkle on “sija”, no violin/film strings]
Zbog tebe ja ne mogu spavati
[kick pattern simplifies 1 bar, bass holds, then snaps back in]
Dokle više osmeh drugima ćeš davati
[hat fill + tiny tire screech before “davati”]
I koliko će ovo ludilo još da traje
[serpentine arp run climbing into “traje”, then cuts]

[Chorus 2 – Same as first chorus but with thicker backing: extra octave harmony, slightly brighter top-end, more aggressive drum bus compression for lift. Still tight mix, no melodrama.]
[Chorus]
Želeo bih ljubav da ti dam
(bg harmony: low male 3rd under “da ti dam”)
Da li je želiš i ti meni dati
[FX – car honk stab on downbeat of this line]
Sve što oduvek sam hteo je da te svojom mogu zvati
[delay throw on “zvati”, 1/4 ping-pong, filtered]
I sad verujem da nije kasno
Iako mi ništa nije jasno
Sve sam spreman ja za tebe da izdržim
[pad opens slightly; drums push a bit harder in last bar]

[Instrumental – Explosive synth break. Vocals drop out. Fast, syncopated drums and thick bass take over, with serpentine arpeggiated synth lead in front, weaving Turkish scales. Car honks and tire screeches punctuate transitions every 2–4 bars, timed to fills. Short risers/impacts, no big sentimental pads, no violins.]
[Instrumental]

[Verse 3 – Beat returns full but slightly stripped for first 2 lines (less hats), then rebuilds. Vocal very present, a bit more intensity, but controlled and not overacted. Arps and lead sit just behind vocal.]
[Verse 3]
Po ceo dan ja tebe želim gledati
[pads slightly darker here, drums tight]
Samo su mi važni tvoji dodiri
[short staccato synth plucks answering “dodiri”]
Ove noći tako jako trebaš meni
[808 hits accent “jako”, subtle glide up]
Ti si bol koju želim ja da osećam
[brief arp run low in mix, no sad strings]
Tvoja slika ovu glavu me podseća
Da ništa ne vredi osim nas
[delay on “osim nas”, 1/4 note, filtered; drums stay driving]

[Chorus 3 – Big combined hook section: drums bright, bass thick, arps + lead moving. Stacked harmonies on key phrases, but concise and rhythmic. Effects stay subtle, serving movement.]
[Chorus]
Svoje misli puštam dalje
Kad tebi svoju ljubav šaljem
Da te vratim sve od sebe dajem
Hajde mala jednom reci mi
Šta je tako posebno na tebi
I kakvo ti to zlato na licu sija
Po ceo dan ja tebe želim gledati
Samo su mi važni tvoji dodiri
Ove noći tako jako trebaš meni

[Chorus 4 – Final peak: same lyrics as previous chorus block, with slightly louder backing vocals and more aggressive synths. Master bus gently pushed +0.5–1 dB for climax. No extra reverb washes; keep it punchy, club-ready.]
[Chorus]
Želeo bih ljubav da ti dam
Da li je želiš i ti men

---

# hardcore_pop - Dunyaaa- Hardcore_Pop_1
[DESCRIPTION]
A bouncy underground slap-club tech Turkish oriental pop track erupts with fast, syncopated electronic drums, thick pulsating bass, and serpentine arpeggiated synths weaving Turkish scales. # hardcore_pop - Dunyaaa- Hardcore_Pop_2
[DESCRIPTION]
A bouncy underground slap-club tech Balkan oriental pop track erupts with fast, syncopated electronic drums, thick pulsating bass, and serpentine arpeggiated synths weaving Balkan scales. Car honks and tire screeches punctuate fills and transitions, adding street attitude without ever drowning the vocal. Dynamic dance grooves power nonstop movement while silk-smooth, auto-tune-free vocals glide on top, crystal-clear and expressive, shaped only by tasteful compression, light saturation, tight plate reverb, and tempo-locked delays. Sparse, focused traditional elements (zurna/saz-like leads, oriental pads) sit inside a tight, modern mix with subtle effects, letting rhythm and melody reign through verse–chorus loops and explosive synth breaks. The sound must stay energetic, punchy, and club-ready at all times

[LYRICS]
[Intro]
Ay, ay, ay, ay, ay, ay, ay, ay
Ay, ay, ay, ay, ay, ay, ay, ay
Ay, ay, ay, ay, ay, ay, ay, ay
Ay, ay, ay, ay, ay, ay, ay, ay

[Verse 1]
Kojom ulicom korakom u noći
Mislim samo da li ćeš mi doći
I šta se to sa nama desilo

[Chorus 1]
Svoje misli puštam dalje
Kad tebi svoju ljubav šaljem
Da te vratim sve od sebe dajem

[Verse 2]
Hajde mala jednom reci mi
Šta je tako posebno na tebi
I kakvo ti to zlato na licu sija
Zbog tebe ja ne mogu spavati
Dokle više osmeh drugima ćeš davati
I koliko će ovo ludilo još da traje

[Chorus 2]
Želeo bih ljubav da ti dam
Da li je želiš i ti meni dati
Sve što oduvek sam hteo je da te svojom mogu zvati
I sad verujem da nije kasno
Iako mi ništa nije jasno
Sve sam spreman ja za tebe da izdržim

[Instrumental – no lyrics]

[Verse 3]
Po ceo dan ja tebe želim gledati
Samo su mi važni tvoji dodiri
Ove noći tako jako trebaš meni
Ti si bol koju želim ja da osećam
Tvoja slika ovu glavu me podseća
Da ništa ne vredi osim nas

[Chorus 3]
Svoje misli puštam dalje
Kad tebi svoju ljubav šaljem
Da te vratim sve od sebe dajem
Hajde mala jednom reci mi
Šta je tako posebno na tebi
I kakvo ti to zlato na licu sija
Po ceo dan ja tebe želim gledati
Samo su mi važni tvoji dodiri
Ove noći tako jako trebaš meni

[Chorus 4]
Želeo bih ljubav da ti dam
Da li je želiš i ti meni dati
Sve što oduvek sam hteo je da te svojom mogu zvati
I sad verujem da nije kasno
Iako mi ništa nije jasno
Sve sam spreman ja za tebe da izdržim
Želeo bih ljubav da ti dam
Da li je želiš i ti meni dati
Sve što oduvek sam hteo je da te svojom mogu zvati
I sad verujem da nije kasno
Iako mi ništa nije jasno
Sve sam spreman ja za tebe da izdržim

---

# hardcore_pop - Dunyaaa- Hardcore_Pop_3
[DESCRIPTION]
A bouncy slap-club tech Balkan oriental pop track launches with syncopated electronic drums and thick, driving bass, interwoven with serpentine arpeggiated synths on Balkan modes. Car honks and tire screeches highlight fills. Punchy club grooves surge throughout, with crystal-clear, dry vocals over a modern blend of sparse zurna/saz leads and airy oriental pads, all tightly mixed. Explosive synth breaks and dynamic verse–chorus loops keep energy and rhythm relentlessly kinetic and danceable.

[LYRICS]
[Intro]
Ay, ay, ay, ay, ay, ay, ay, ay
Ay, ay, ay, ay, ay, ay, ay, ay
Ay, ay, ay, ay, ay, ay, ay, ay
Ay, ay, ay, ay, ay, ay, ay, ay

[Verse 1]
Kojom ulicom korakom u noći
Mislim samo da li ćeš mi doći
I šta se to sa nama desilo

[Chorus 1]
Svoje misli puštam dalje
Kad tebi svoju ljubav šaljem
Da te vratim sve od sebe dajem

[Verse 2]
Hajde mala jednom reci mi
Šta je tako posebno na tebi
I kakvo ti to zlato na licu sija
Zbog tebe ja ne mogu spavati
Dokle više osmeh drugima ćeš davati
I koliko će ovo ludilo još da traje

[Chorus 2]
Želeo bih ljubav da ti dam
Da li je želiš i ti meni dati
Sve što oduvek sam hteo je da te svojom mogu zvati

Samo su mi važni tvoji dodiri
Ove noći tako jako trebaš meni
Ti si bol koju želim ja da osećam
Tvoja slika ovu glavu me podseća
Da ništa ne vredi osim nas

Svoje misli puštam dalje
Kad tebi svoju ljubav šaljem
Da te vratim sve od sebe dajem
Hajde mala jednom reci mi
Šta je tako posebno na tebi
I kakvo ti to zlato na licu sija
Po ceo dan ja tebe želim gledati

Ove noći tako jako trebaš meni

[DESCRIPTION]

Car honks and tire screeches highlight fills. Punchy club grooves surge throughout, with crystal-clear, dry vocals over a modern blend of sparse zurna/saz leads and airy oriental pads, all tightly mixed. Explosive synth breaks and dynamic verse–chorus loops keep energy and rhythm relentlessly kinetic and danceable.

# hardcore_pop - EDM_Hardcore_Pop_1
[DESCRIPTION]
The tech house track at 128 bpm launches with a morphing deep bassline and sharp, syncopated percussion layered over atmospheric club noise. Siren risers and rave samples punctuate the buildup as 80s-inspired midi synths introduce infectious hooks. Drops explode with crowd roars, punchy chopped chant vocals, and intensified rhythmic interplay, sustaining a propulsive, communal club energy.

[LYRICS]
[Intro — 0:00–0:28 — bright, immediate groove]
[ARR: open on punchy kick + sidechained subbed bass pluck; 80s MIDI chord stab (bright) center, sampled crowd chants looped rhythmic 2-bar phrase; PROC: kick transient +8% with slight pitch-envelope drop first 2 bars; HATS: open hat on off-beat with gated reverb 12% send; MIX: widen synths slightly, keep sub mono; FX: short crowd hits processed with transient designer for punch.]
Kažem ti brate...
Mene ne ra-di....
(crowd chant — rhythmic)

[Pre-Build — 0:28–1:04 — tension with melodic hooks]
[ARR: introduce siren-style riser (vintage saw) layered with pitch-modulated 80s lead; chop rave sample into staccato rhythmic FX; PROC: arpeggio 4-voice unison, slight chorus, HPF sweep 200→1.8k; VOCALS: bring in short vocal mantra — hard-tuned, short decay, repeated 4 bars; MIX: add stereo delay 1/8 to vocal, automating feedback into drop.]
....Ako nema više...
Nećemo mi stru-ga-ti.... (No no mhm hm)
(chant mantra — tight)

[Main Groove — 1:04–1:56 — chant explosion]
[ARR: full percussion stack, bassline morphs subtly via LFO-controlled wavetable to grow brighter over 16 bars; PROC: bass a mix of hollow sub + mid growl, mid growl layered with distortion and filtered to taste; HATS: rolling 1/16 with triplet shuffle, claps on 2&4 doubled; FX: crowd cheer sample hits on every 8 bars, bring in 80s synth hook full volume after 8 bars; SIDECHAIN: strong ducking on pads and stabs keyed to kick (ratio 6:1).]
(crowd cheer — explode)

[Mid Groove / Vocal Hook — 1:56–2:40 — anthem moment]
[ARR: vocal chant hook center-stage — processed with vocoder mild + formant shift for club character; PROC: parallel distortion 30% on chant, compressor 3:1 to glue, small hall reverb 22% send; SYNTH: add bright octave lead for harmonic lift; MIX: raise 2–6k by +2dB for vocal intelligibility in club; BUS: glue 1.4:1.]
Onda vadi tsrtaj, nemoj nas sekirati
(anthem chant — sing)

[Dynamic Shift — 2:40–3:16 — textural play]
[ARR: drop elements to create space — remove bass mid-growl for 4 bars, keep kick low filtered, chopped rave vox used as percussive element; PROC: automate lowpass on master 1200→300Hz for 4 bars; FX: reverse crowd swell into re-entry; MIX: transition with tempo-synced delay tails.]
Nećemo valjda stru-ga-ti
(whisper chant — filtered)

[Peak Repeat — 3:16–4:00 — club peak loop]
[ARR: bring all elements back — heavier synth unison (6→12 voices), doubled chant with octave detune, layered clap stacks, snare roll into loop; PROC: bus saturation +2dB pre-master, stereo enhancer on 80s hooks, transient shaping on kick to keep punch; MIX: ensure sub <100Hz mono, widen 4–8k band slightly for sparkle.]
Vadi... Tsrtaj...
(crowd — sing back)

[Bridge + DJ Tools — 4:00–4:40 — playable stems]
[ARR: create DJ-friendly deliverables: 8-bar chant loop dry, 8-bar instrumental loop with bright hook, 16-bar intro beat only; PROC: render chant loops dry and with club reverb; EXPORT: Stems labeled and tempo/key info embedded in file metadata; MASTER: -6 LUFS club master and -9 LUFS radio/promos.]
(leave with chant echo)

MASTERING NOTES (apply to full track)
[MASTER: corrective EQ -1.5dB 220–380Hz; multi-band comp tighten bass; mild stereo tape sat +1.8dB; transient enhancer on kick +1.2dB; imager mono <120Hz; limiter -0.3dB; TARGET -6 LUFS integrated; CHECK: club PA at 100–110 dB, headphones, phone speaker for low-end check.]
(ready for clubs)

PRODUCTION & MIXING TIPS COMMON TO BOTH VERSIONS
[LAYOUT: keep arrangement loops predictable for DJ mixing — 32/16 bar phrases, clear intro/outro sections; AUTOMATION: automate unison voices, filter sweeps, and saturation for evolving interest; SAMPLE CHOICES: use high-res crowd samples and pitch-match to key; SUB MANAGEMENT: always mono below 100–120Hz; QC: phase-check, stem-check, and reference against two commercial tracks in same BPM/key; EXPORT: include tempo-map, suggested harmonic key, and stems named logically.]
(final club-ready pack)

---

# hardcore_pop - EDM_Hardcore_Pop_1
[DESCRIPTION]
The tech house track at 128 bpm launches with a morphing deep bassline and sharp, syncopated percussion layered over atmospheric club noise. Siren risers and rave samples punctuate the buildup as 80s-inspired midi synths introduce infectious hooks. Drops explode with crowd roars, punchy chopped chant vocals, and intensified rhythmic interplay, sustaining a propulsive, communal club energy.

[LYRICS]
[Intro — 0:00–0:28 — bright, immediate groove]
[ARR: open on punchy kick + sidechained subbed bass pluck; 80s MIDI chord stab (bright) center, sampled crowd chants looped rhythmic 2-bar phrase; PROC: kick transient +8% with slight pitch-envelope drop first 2 bars; HATS: open hat on off-beat with gated reverb 12% send; MIX: widen synths slightly, keep sub mono; FX: short crowd hits processed with transient designer for punch.]
Kažem ti brate...
Mene ne ra-di....
(crowd chant — rhythmic)

[Pre-Build — 0:28–1:04 — tension with melodic hooks]
[ARR: introduce siren-style riser (vintage saw) layered with pitch-modulated 80s lead; chop rave sample into staccato rhythmic FX; PROC: arpeggio 4-voice unison, slight chorus, HPF sweep 200→1.8k; VOCALS: bring in short vocal mantra — hard-tuned, short decay, repeated 4 bars; MIX: add stereo delay 1/8 to vocal, automating feedback into drop.]
....Ako nema više...
Nećemo mi stru-ga-ti.... (No no mhm hm)
(chant mantra — tight)

[Main Groove — 1:04–1:56 — chant explosion]
[ARR: full percussion stack, bassline morphs subtly via LFO-controlled wavetable to grow brighter over 16 bars; PROC: bass a mix of hollow sub + mid growl, mid growl layered with distortion and filtered to taste; HATS: rolling 1/16 with triplet shuffle, claps on 2&4 doubled; FX: crowd cheer sample hits on every 8 bars, bring in 80s synth hook full volume after 8 bars; SIDECHAIN: strong ducking on pads and stabs keyed to kick (ratio 6:1).]
(crowd cheer — explode)

[Mid Groove / Vocal Hook — 1:56–2:40 — anthem moment]
[ARR: vocal chant hook center-stage — processed with vocoder mild + formant shift for club character; PROC: parallel distortion 30% on chant, compressor 3:1 to glue, small hall reverb 22% send; SYNTH: add bright octave lead for harmonic lift; MIX: raise 2–6k by +2dB for vocal intelligibility in club; BUS: glue 1.4:1.]
Onda vadi tsrtaj, nemoj nas sekirati
(anthem chant — sing)

[Dynamic Shift — 2:40–3:16 — textural play]
[ARR: drop elements to create space — remove bass mid-growl for 4 bars, keep kick low filtered, chopped rave vox used as percussive element; PROC: automate lowpass on master 1200→300Hz for 4 bars; FX: reverse crowd swell into re-entry; MIX: transition with tempo-synced delay tails.]
Nećemo valjda stru-ga-ti
(whisper chant — filtered)

[Peak Repeat — 3:16–4:00 — club peak loop]
[ARR: bring all elements back — heavier synth unison (6→12 voices), doubled chant with octave detune, layered clap stacks, snare roll into loop; PROC: bus saturation +2dB pre-master, stereo enhancer on 80s hooks, transient shaping on kick to keep punch; MIX: ensure sub <100Hz mono, widen 4–8k band slightly for sparkle.]
Vadi... Tsrtaj...
(crowd — sing back)

[Bridge + DJ Tools — 4:00–4:40 — playable stems]
[ARR: create DJ-friendly deliverables: 8-bar chant loop dry, 8-bar instrumental loop with bright hook, 16-bar intro beat only; PROC: render chant loops dry and with club reverb; EXPORT: Stems labeled and tempo/key info embedded in file metadata; MASTER: -6 LUFS club master and -9 LUFS radio/promos.]
(leave with chant echo)

MASTERING NOTES (apply to full track)
[MASTER: corrective EQ -1.5dB 220–380Hz; multi-band comp tighten bass; mild stereo tape sat +1.8dB; transient enhancer on kick +1.2dB; imager mono <120Hz; limiter -0.3dB; TARGET -6 LUFS integrated; CHECK: club PA at 100–110 dB, headphones, phone speaker for low-end check.]
(ready for clubs)

PRODUCTION & MIXING TIPS COMMON TO BOTH VERSIONS
[LAYOUT: keep arrangement loops predictable for DJ mixing — 32/16 bar phrases, clear intro/outro sections; AUTOMATION: automate unison voices, filter sweeps, and saturation for evolving interest; SAMPLE CHOICES: use high-res crowd samples and pitch-match to key; SUB MANAGEMENT: always mono below 100–120Hz; QC: phase-check, stem-check, and reference against two commercial tracks in same BPM/key; EXPORT: include tempo-map, suggested harmonic key, and stems named logically.]
(final club-ready pack)

# hardcore_pop - EDM_Hardcore_Pop_2
[DESCRIPTION]
The tech house track at 128 bpm launches with a morphing deep bassline and sharp, syncopated percussion layered over atmospheric club noise. Siren risers and rave samples punctuate the buildup as 80s-inspired midi synths introduce infectious hooks. Drops explode with crowd roars, punchy chopped chant vocals, and intensified rhythmic interplay, sustaining a propulsive, communal club energy.

[LYRICS]
[Intro — 0:00–0:28 — bright, immediate groove]
[ARR: open on punchy kick + sidechained subbed bass pluck; 80s MIDI chord stab (bright) center, sampled crowd chants looped rhythmic 2-bar phrase; PROC: kick transient +8% with slight pitch-envelope drop first 2 bars; HATS: open hat on off-beat with gated reverb 12% send; MIX: widen synths slightly, keep sub mono; FX: short crowd hits processed with transient designer for punch.]
[Verse]
In the corner where the shadows play
Deep bass calling
Can’t stay away
Lights pulse sharp
... God damn.... it gonna slice the air
(crowd chant — rhythmic)

[Pre-Build — 0:28–1:04 — tension with melodic hooks]
[ARR: introduce siren-style riser (vintage saw) layered with pitch-modulated 80s lead; chop rave sample into staccato rhythmic FX; PROC: arpeggio 4-voice unison, slight chorus, HPF sweep 200→1.8k; VOCALS: bring in short vocal mantra — hard-tuned, short decay, repeated 4 bars; MIX: add stereo delay 1/8 to vocal, automating feedback into drop.]
Lights pulse sharp
... God damn.... it gonna slice the air
(chant mantra — tight)

[Main Groove — 1:04–1:56 — chant explosion]
[ARR: full percussion stack, bassline morphs subtly via LFO-controlled wavetable to grow brighter over 16 bars; PROC: bass a mix of hollow sub + mid growl, mid growl layered with distortion and filtered to taste; HATS: rolling 1/16 with triplet shuffle, claps on 2&4 doubled; FX: crowd cheer sample hits on every 8 bars, bring in 80s synth hook full volume after 8 bars; SIDECHAIN: strong ducking on pads and stabs keyed to kick (ratio 6:1).]
Lights pulse sharp
... God damn.... it gonna slice the air
(crowd cheer — explode)

[Mid Groove / Vocal Hook — 1:56–2:40 — anthem moment]
[ARR: vocal chant hook center-stage — processed with vocoder mild + formant shift for club character; PROC: parallel distortion 30% on chant, compressor 3:1 to glue, small hall reverb 22% send; SYNTH: add bright octave lead for harmonic lift; MIX: raise 2–6k by +2dB for vocal intelligibility in club; BUS: glue 1.4:1.]
Echoes bounce where the lasers fly
Sweat-soaked faces
Strangers collide
Lost in the rhythm
Nowhere to hide
(anthem chant — sing)

[Dynamic Shift — 2:40–3:16 — textural play]
[ARR: drop elements to create space — remove bass mid-growl for 4 bars, keep kick low filtered, chopped rave vox used as percussive element; PROC: automate lowpass on master 1200→300Hz for 4 bars; FX: reverse crowd swell into re-entry; MIX: transition with tempo-synced delay tails.]
Do you feel it
Do you hear it

Can’t stay away
Lights pulse sharp
... God damn.... it gonna slice the air
(whisper chant — filtered, backvocal chopped))

[Peak Repeat — 3:16–4:00 — club peak loop]
[ARR: bring all elements back — heavier synth unison (6→12 voices), doubled chant with octave detune, layered clap stacks, snare roll into loop; PROC: bus saturation +2dB pre-master, stereo enhancer on 80s hooks, transient shaping on kick to keep punch; MIX: ensure sub <100Hz mono, widen 4–8k band slightly for sparkle.]
Rave ghosts linger
They haunt the floor
Each beat a key to an unseen door
Shadows twist as the sound unfolds
(crowd — sing back)

[Bridge + DJ Tools — 4:00–4:40 — playable stems]
[ARR: create DJ-friendly deliverables: 8-bar chant loop dry, 8-bar instrumental loop with bright hook, 16-bar intro beat only; PROC: render chant loops dry and with club reverb; EXPORT: Stems labeled and tempo/key info embedded in file metadata; MASTER: -6 LUFS club master and -9 LUFS radio/promos.]
Deep bass calling
Can’t stay away
(leave with chant echo)

MASTERING NOTES (apply to full track)
[MASTER: corrective EQ -1.5dB 220–380Hz; multi-band comp tighten bass; mild stereo tape sat +1.8dB; transient enhancer on kick +1.2dB; imager mono <120Hz; limiter -0.3dB; TARGET -6 LUFS integrated; CHECK: club PA at 100–110 dB, headphones, phone speaker for low-end check.]
(ready for clubs)

PRODUCTION & MIXING TIPS COMMON TO BOTH VERSIONS
[LAYOUT: keep arrangement loops predictable for DJ mixing — 32/16 bar phrases, clear intro/outro sections; AUTOMATION: automate unison voices, filter sweeps, and saturation for evolving interest; SAMPLE CHOICES: use high-res crowd samples and pitch-match to key; SUB MANAGEMENT: always mono below 100–120Hz; QC: phase-check, stem-check, and reference against two commercial tracks in same BPM/key; EXPORT: include tempo-map, suggested harmonic key, and stems named logically.]
(final club-ready pack)

# hardcore_pop - EDM_Hardcore_Pop_2
[DESCRIPTION]
The tech house track at 128 bpm launches with a morphing deep bassline and sharp, syncopated percussion layered over atmospheric club noise. Siren risers and rave samples punctuate the buildup as 80s-inspired midi synths introduce infectious hooks. Drops explode with crowd roars, punchy chopped chant vocals, and intensified rhythmic interplay, sustaining a propulsive, communal club energy.

Lights pulse sharp
