# hardcore_pop - Setih-te se- Hardcore_Pop_1
[DESCRIPTION]
[Track–Bouncy underground slap-club Balkan oriental pop, ~122 BPM, minor key but uplifting drive. Constant dance-floor groove with tight club kick+slap bass, groovy percussion, oriental leads (zurna/clarinet/gusle-like synths), wide pads and organ stabs. Car honks and tire-screech FX used as rhythmic fills and transitions, never overwhelming the vocal. Arrangement builds in waves, always pushing forward, zero dead space.]

[LYRICS]
[Intro/Verse 1–Felt piano+soft pluck/organ only, no full drums. Low slap-bass ghosts root notes (LPF). Very quiet oriental hook in back. Rare distant car honk FX. Vocal dry-ish, close, compressed, light plate 5–7%, no delay, no autotune, intimate tone.]
Kad bih imao krila goluba
Daleko da odletim
Da nađem neko mesto
Gde bih mogo da se odmorim
Oči da zatvorim
U senku da se sklonim

[Pre-build–Add soft club kick every 2nd bar, faint clap ghost, subtle shaker. Bass opens slightly. Airy pad, quiet reversed tire-screech into phrases. Light slapback only on last words, +2–3 dB presence at 3–4 kHz to push vocal forward while natural.]
Pokaži mi put, dragi Bože
Tebi da se poklonim
Jer istina si ti
Sve ostalo je lažno
Jer sve to što oni vrednuju
Meni nije važno – novac i moć
To je sada prestiž
A ja dižem ruke prema tebi
I molim da me se setiš...

[Hook entry–Full slap-club drums: short punchy kick, round sub+slap bass, tight clap/snare with tiny room verb, 1/8 hats + rare 1/16 fills. Simple oriental lead hook on top. Car honks as short syncopated stabs, tire-screech riser into first “Ref.”; pads/strings open wide.]
[Hook vocal–Lead center, lightly doubled, low L/R doubles. Plate 10–12%, 1/4 delay on line ends (“seti me se”, “vreme moje”). Section +1–1.5 dB vs verse. No autotune, just strong gospel/trap delivery.]
Ref.
Molim te, seti me se
Kada dođe vreme moje
Molim te, seti me se
Seti se desnice svoje

[Verse 2–Same kit, drums -10–15% for space. Hats add occasional triplet rolls. Bass more melodic with subtle glides. Piano hits mid chords on backbeat; oriental synth simpler. Strings warm and low under key phrases, groove still club-ready.]
[Vocal–Mild tube sat 5–7%, 4:1–6:1 compression, stable level. Slight stereo widen on sustained words, main phrases center. Reverb shorter than hook, clear consonants, no pitch FX.]
Uzmi onaj kamen
Napravi me ponovo
Sve tvoje rane bole
Teške srcu kao olovo
I osećam da jedu me
Od kad si me okovo
Reči nisam pustio
Ni kad najteže sam bolovo

[Verse 2 build–Add rim ghost notes, soft shaker, tiny tom fills before turns. Pads/strings slowly open. Short car-honk fills on bar ends, reversed tire-screech into “držim”, “kružim”, “tužim”.]
[Vocal–Short stereo doubles on last syllables, +0.5–1 dB vocal lift this half, slightly longer verb tail on key words.]
Jer zaveta se držim
Ne idem putevima lakšim i bržim
Bolje i gladan po gradu da kružim
Čekam te, sedim u mraku i tužim
Daj mi snage da izdržim
Da ispuni se sve
Da ispuni se sve
Sve što za mene pisano je

[Hook 2–Max-intensity chorus. Drums a bit brighter, hats more open, extra perc layer. High strings counter-melody, louder choir pad. Noise riser+tire-screech swell into first line. Parallel drum bus comp for extra smack.]
[Hook 2 vocal–4–6 layers, doubles more present on toplines. Gentle high-shelf 8–10 kHz, de-essed. Reverb/delay same or +10% vs Hook 1, always in tempo.]
Uzmi onaj kamen
Napravi me ponovo
Sve tvoje rane bole
Teške srcu kao olovo
I osećam da jedu me
Od kad si me okovo
Reči nisam pustio
Ni kad najteže sam bolovo
Jer zaveta se držim
Ne idem putevima lakšim i bržim
Bolje i gladan po gradu da kružim
Čekam te, sedim u mraku i tužim
Daj mi snage da izdržim
Da ispuni se sve
Da ispuni se sve
Sve što za mene pisano je

[Bridge–Energy drop but still bounce. Just muted kick+rim sparse, hats muted/minimal, simple bass roots. Cinematic strings + high piano arps lead. Pads mid-focused. Global reverb send +10–15% for wide, “church-in-a-club” feel; rare distant car honk to keep street vibe.]
[Vocal–Breathier tone, more reverb (15–18%), dotted 1/8 delay on line ends, a bit wider stereo, lead still clear.]
Kažu da ovde je kraj
Ne želim da im verujem
Tako se ubija zvezda sjaj
Ne znam, možda preterujem
Kad pomislim da sreća tu je
Ona uvek mi izmice
I šta je danas sigurno
Osim odakle potičeš

[Bridge repeat–Rebuild: soft hats return, more active strings, louder choir “aaah” pad, bass opening. Slow noise riser + short tire-screech into last lines. Master +0.5 dB last bars for lift.]
[Vocal–More intensity, slightly more sat, stronger doubles on “zvezda sjaj” and “sigurno”, darker verbs to avoid harshness.]
Kažu da ovde je kraj
Ne želim da im verujem
Tako se ubija zvezda sjaj
Ne znam, možda preterujem
Kad pomislim da sreća tu je
Ona uvek mi izmice
I šta je danas sigurno
Osim odakle potičeš

[Outro–Stepwise drum fade: mute hats/perc, lower clap/snare, then drop kick+bass. Final bar or two with only one distant honk/screech motif. End on piano+pad+low choir, long 6–8 s reverb tail, slow LPF closing whole mix like club lights going down.]

---

# hardcore_pop - Setih-te se- Hardcore_Pop_1
[DESCRIPTION]
[Track–Bouncy underground slap-club Balkan oriental pop, ~122 BPM, minor key but uplifting drive. Constant dance-floor groove with tight club kick+slap bass, groovy percussion, oriental leads (zurna/clarinet/gusle-like synths), wide pads and organ stabs. Car honks and tire-screech FX used as rhythmic fills and transitions, never overwhelming the vocal. Arrangement builds in waves, always pushing forward, zero dead space.]

[LYRICS]
[Intro/Verse 1–Felt piano+soft pluck/organ only, no full drums. Low slap-bass ghosts root notes (LPF). Very quiet oriental hook in back. Rare distant car honk FX. Vocal dry-ish, close, compressed, light plate 5–7%, no delay, no autotune, intimate tone.]
Kad bih imao krila goluba
Daleko da odletim
Da nađem neko mesto
Gde bih mogo da se odmorim
Oči da zatvorim
U senku da se sklonim

[Pre-build–Add soft club kick every 2nd bar, faint clap ghost, subtle shaker. Bass opens slightly. Airy pad, quiet reversed tire-screech into phrases. Light slapback only on last words, +2–3 dB presence at 3–4 kHz to push vocal forward while natural.]
Pokaži mi put, dragi Bože
Tebi da se poklonim
Jer istina si ti
Sve ostalo je lažno
Jer sve to što oni vrednuju
Meni nije važno – novac i moć
To je sada prestiž
A ja dižem ruke prema tebi
I molim da me se setiš...

[Hook entry–Full slap-club drums: short punchy kick, round sub+slap bass, tight clap/snare with tiny room verb, 1/8 hats + rare 1/16 fills. Simple oriental lead hook on top. Car honks as short syncopated stabs, tire-screech riser into first “Ref.”; pads/strings open wide.]
[Hook vocal–Lead center, lightly doubled, low L/R doubles. Plate 10–12%, 1/4 delay on line ends (“seti me se”, “vreme moje”). Section +1–1.5 dB vs verse. No autotune, just strong gospel/trap delivery.]
Ref.
Molim te, seti me se
Kada dođe vreme moje
Molim te, seti me se
Seti se desnice svoje

[Verse 2–Same kit, drums -10–15% for space. Hats add occasional triplet rolls. Bass more melodic with subtle glides. Piano hits mid chords on backbeat; oriental synth simpler. Strings warm and low under key phrases, groove still club-ready.]
[Vocal–Mild tube sat 5–7%, 4:1–6:1 compression, stable level. Slight stereo widen on sustained words, main phrases center. Reverb shorter than hook, clear consonants, no pitch FX.]
Uzmi onaj kamen
Napravi me ponovo
Sve tvoje rane bole
Teške srcu kao olovo
I osećam da jedu me
Od kad si me okovo
Reči nisam pustio
Ni kad najteže sam bolovo

[Verse 2 build–Add rim ghost notes, soft shaker, tiny tom fills before turns. Pads/strings slowly open. Short car-honk fills on bar ends, reversed tire-screech into “držim”, “kružim”, “tužim”.]
[Vocal–Short stereo doubles on last syllables, +0.5–1 dB vocal lift this half, slightly longer verb tail on key words.]
Jer zaveta se držim
Ne idem putevima lakšim i bržim
Bolje i gladan po gradu da kružim
Čekam te, sedim u mraku i tužim
Daj mi snage da izdržim
Da ispuni se sve
Da ispuni se sve
Sve što za mene pisano je

[Hook 2–Max-intensity chorus. Drums a bit brighter, hats more open, extra perc layer. High strings counter-melody, louder choir pad. Noise riser+tire-screech swell into first line. Parallel drum bus comp for extra smack.]
[Hook 2 vocal–4–6 layers, doubles more present on toplines. Gentle high-shelf 8–10 kHz, de-essed. Reverb/delay same or +10% vs Hook 1, always in tempo.]
Uzmi onaj kamen
Napravi me ponovo
Sve tvoje rane bole
Teške srcu kao olovo
I osećam da jedu me
Od kad si me okovo
Reči nisam pustio
Ni kad najteže sam bolovo
Jer zaveta se držim
Ne idem putevima lakšim i bržim
Bolje i gladan po gradu da kružim
Čekam te, sedim u mraku i tužim
Daj mi snage da izdržim
Da ispuni se sve
Da ispuni se sve
Sve što za mene pisano je

[Bridge–Energy drop but still bounce. Just muted kick+rim sparse, hats muted/minimal, simple bass roots. Cinematic strings + high piano arps lead. Pads mid-focused. Global reverb send +10–15% for wide, “church-in-a-club” feel; rare distant car honk to keep street vibe.]
[Vocal–Breathier tone, more reverb (15–18%), dotted 1/8 delay on line ends, a bit wider stereo, lead still clear.]
Kažu da ovde je kraj
Ne želim da im verujem
Tako se ubija zvezda sjaj
Ne znam, možda preterujem
Kad pomislim da sreća tu je
Ona uvek mi izmice
I šta je danas sigurno
Osim odakle potičeš

[Bridge repeat–Rebuild: soft hats return, more active strings, louder choir “aaah” pad, bass opening. Slow noise riser + short tire-screech into last lines. Master +0.5 dB last bars for lift.]
[Vocal–More intensity, slightly more sat, stronger doubles on “zvezda sjaj” and “sigurno”, darker verbs to avoid harshness.]
Kažu da ovde je kraj
Ne želim da im verujem
Tako se ubija zvezda sjaj
Ne znam, možda preterujem
Kad pomislim da sreća tu je
Ona uvek mi izmice
I šta je danas sigurno
Osim odakle potičeš

[Outro–Stepwise drum fade: mute hats/perc, lower clap/snare, then drop kick+bass. Final bar or two with only one distant honk/screech motif. End on piano+pad+low choir, long 6–8 s reverb tail, slow LPF closing whole mix like club lights going down.]

# hardcore_pop - Shantelijah x Vocnjacc - Ljubav Ohola
[DESCRIPTION]
Pulsing, distorted Balkan-tech grooves intertwine with deep, dominating basslines, while syncopated percussion and traditional Eastern European elements weave in and out, Sultry, heavily autotuned female vocals add velvety layers, creating a hypnotic, dark, and luxurious dancefloor energy

[LYRICS]
[Intstrumental - go crazy]

[Female 1 - Intro - Atmospheric Build]
da samo sam znala ne bih ti sve dala
nisam znala da si takav gad,
ti doveo si me do prosjačkog štapa.
sad ostade mi samo da tugujem i sa čašom drugujem.

[Female 2 - Chorus - High Energy Drop]
Koštala me, koštala ljubav tvoja o-ho-la.
sve si mi uzeo i snove razbio si mi.
nema ničega više sada tu.
ostala sam saama tu, u ovom lu-di-luuuu.

[Male 1 - Verse - Balkan Trap Flow]
Ja te voleo i srce svoje ti dao, i ne samo to.
uzela si sve što jesam i nisam i-ma-o.
zbog tebe mi ostali samo dugovi.
više me ne vole čak ni druuuugovi.

[Male 2 - Chorus - High Energy Drop]
Koštala me, koštala ljubav tvoja o-ho-la.
sve si mi uzela i snove razbila  si miiiiii.
nema ničega više sada tu.
ostao sam saam ovde, u ovom ludiluuuu.

[Female 1 - Verse]
Više nisam ni pola od onog što bila sam.
samo bih nešto jako popila saaaad,
da ublažim tugu i bol od gluposti svoje.
da zaboravim da bili smo dvoooooje.

[Female 2 - Chorus - High Energy Drop]
Koštala me, koštala ljubav tvoja o-ho-la.
sve si mi uzeo i snove razbio si miiiii.
nema ničega više sada tu.
ostala sam saama tu, u ovom ludiluuuuu.

[Male 1 - Bridge - Atmospheric Build]
Nekako ću da se oporavim znaaaaam.
ali da lako zavolim nikad više neću to znam.
dosta je bilo jednom patnja i bankrot ovaj.
ne treba meni nikako život ovakav.

[Male 2 - Chorus - High Energy Drop]
Koštala me, koštala ljubav tvoja o-ho-la.
sve si mi uzela i snove razbila  si miiiiii.
nema ničega više sada tu.
ostao sam saam ovde, u ovom ludiluuuu.

[Both - Outro - Beat Switch]
Koštala me, koštala ljubav tvoja o-ho-la.
sve si mi uzeo i snove razbio si mi.
nema ničega više sada tuuuuuu.
ostali smo sami ovde, u ovom ludiluuuuuu.

[Both - Outro - Fade Out]
Baš nas je koštala ljubav ova blesava. idemo jer to nam ne treba!
ne trebaaa, o neee neee

# hardcore_pop - Shantelijah x Vocnjacc - Ljubav Ohola
[DESCRIPTION]
A pulsing Balkan-tech groove forms the core, where distorted synth stabs and bold basslines drive relentless momentum. Syncopated percussion and Eastern European folk melodies surface between transitions. Sultry, autotuned female vocals float atop, thickening the hypnotic, dark dancefloor atmosphere.

[LYRICS]
[Intstrumental - go crazy]

[Female 1 - Intro]
da samo sam znala ne bih ti sve dala
nisam znala da si takav gad,
ti doveo si me do prosjačkog štapa.
sad ostade mi samo da tugujem i sa čašom drugujem.

[Female 2 - Chorus]
Koštala me, koštala ljubav tvoja o-ho-laaa.
sve si mi uzeo i snove razbio si mi.
nema ničega više sada tu.
ostala sam saama tu, u ovom lu-di-luuuu.

[Male 1 - Verse]
Ja te voleo i srce svoje ti dao, i ne samo to.
uzela si sve što jesam i nisam i-ma-o.
zbog tebe mi ostali samo dugovi.
više me ne vole čak ni druuuugovi.
Koštala me, koštala ljubav tvoja o-ho-laaa.
sve si mi uzela i snove razbila  si miiiiii.
nema ničega više sada tu.
ostao sam saam ovde, u ovom ludiluuuu.

[Female 1 - Verse]
Više nisam ni pola od onog što bila sam.
samo bih nešto jako popila saaaad,
da ublažim tugu i bol od gluposti svoje.
da zaboravim da bili smo dvoooooje.
Koštala me, koštala ljubav tvoja o-ho-laaa.
sve si mi uzeo i snove razbio si miiiii.
nema ničega više sada tu.
ostala sam saama tu, u ovom ludiluuuuu.

[Male 1 - Bridge]
Nekako ću da se oporavim znaaaaam.
ali da lako zavolim nikad više neću to znam.
dosta je bilo jednom patnja i bankrot ovaj.
ne treba meni nikako život ovakav.

[Female- Outro - Beat Switch]
Koštala me, koštala ljubav tvoja o-ho-laaa.
sve si mi uzeo i snove razbio si mi.
nema ničega više sada tuuuuuu.
ostali smo sami ovde, u ovom ludiluuuuuu.

[Both - Together -Outro - Fade Out]
Baš nas je koštala ljubav ova blesava. idemo jer to nam ne treba!
ne trebaaa, o neee neee

# hardcore_pop - Shantelijah x Vocnjacc - Ljubav Ohola- Hardcore_Pop_3
[DESCRIPTION]
bouncy undeground slap club tech Turkish oriental pop ,  organ, zurna, west-coast, car honks, tire screeching, dynamic, dance non-stop groove paired with silk smooth voices, no autotune, just clear vocals

[LYRICS]
[Intstrumental - go crazy]
([dark pad swell] - whoooom)
([distant snare roll] - tchk-tchk-tchk)

[Female]
da samo sam znala ne bih ti sve dala
([BV soft] - „aaah… ne bih…“)
nisam znala da si takav gad,
([BV distant] - „takav gad…“)
ti doveo si me do prosjačkog štapa.
([echo] - „do prosjačkog… štapa…“)
sad ostade mi samo da tugujem i sa čašom drugujem.
([glass clink] - clink) ([BV hum] - mmm-mmm)
Koštala me, koštala ljubav tvoja o-ho-laaa.
([reverb trails] - „o-ho-laaa…“)
sve si mi uzeo i snove razbio si mi.
([vocal stab] - „snove…“)
nema ničega više sada tu.
([delay] - „sada tu… tu…“)
ostala sam saama tu, u ovom lu-di-luuuu.
([cry adlib] - „uuuu…“)

[Male]
Ja te voleo i srce svoje ti dao, i ne samo to.
([BV female pad] - „oooh…“)
uzela si sve što jesam i nisam i-ma-o.
([stutter FX] - „ima-o, ima-o…“)
zbog tebe mi ostali samo dugovi.
([sub drop] - boom)
više me ne vole čak ni druuuugovi.
([gang BV] - „drugovi…“)
Koštala me, koštala ljubav tvoja o-ho-laaa.
([female „aaah“ layered] - aaah-aaah)
sve si mi uzela i snove razbila  si miiiiii.
([long echo] - „miii… miii…“)
nema ničega više sada tu.
([BV whisper] - „nema… ničega…“)
ostao sam saam ovde, u ovom ludiluuuu.
([echo wide] - „ludiluuu…“)

[Female]
Više nisam ni pola od onog što bila sam.
([BV airy] - „ni pola…“)
samo bih nešto jako popila saaaad,
([FX] - sip / ice clink)
da ublažim tugu i bol od gluposti svoje.
([low BV] - „tugu… bol…“)
da zaboravim da bili smo dvoooooje.
([delay] - „dvoje… dvoje…“)
Koštala me, koštala ljubav tvoja o-ho-laaa.
([stacked „o-ho-laaa“ harmonies] - aaah-aaaah)
sve si mi uzeo i snove razbio si miiiii.
([reverse tail] - whooosh)
nema ničega više sada tu.
([whisper pan] - „sada tu…“)
ostala sam saama tu, u ovom ludiluuuuu.
([sigh] - haaah)

[Male]
Nekako ću da se oporavim znaaaaam.
([BV female] - „znaaam…“)
ali da lako zavolim nikad više neću to znam.
([echo] - „neću to znam…“)
dosta je bilo jednom patnja i bankrot ovaj.
([adlib] - „dosta… dosta…“)
ne treba meni nikako život ovakav.
([BV low] - „nikako… ovakav…“)

[Female- Outro - Beat Switch]
([beat switch FX] - tape-stop / whooom)
Koštala me, koštala ljubav tvoja o-ho-laaa.
([wide choir] - „o-ho-laaa…“)
sve si mi uzeo i snove razbio si mi.
([chopped] - „snove… snove…“)
nema ničega više sada tuuuuuu.
([reverb] - „tu… tu…“)
ostali smo sami ovde, u ovom ludiluuuuuu.
([BG adlib] - „sami… sami…“)

[Both - Together -Outro - Fade Out]

([crowd FX] - „hej! hej!“)
ne trebaaa, o neee neee
([call & response] - „ne treba…“ / „o neee…“)
([fade out delays] - neee… neee… neee…)

# hardcore_pop - shemBri Kkontackt_dr_Khans
[DESCRIPTION]
A high-energy Serbian drill banger at 135 BPM with aggressive, sliding 808s and relentless, stuttering hi-hats anchoring the rhythm. Clipped, distorted bass and hard-edged, punchy percussion drive the track. Sparse, fragmented hooks accent sharp melodies, while intensely processed, rapid crew vocals trade off for a menacing, brutal texture.

[DESCRIPTION]
A high-energy Serbian drill banger at 135 BPM with aggressive, sliding 808s and relentless, stuttering hi-hats anchoring the rhythm. Clipped, distorted bass and hard-edged, punchy percussion drive the track. Sparse, fragmented hooks accent sharp melodies, while intensely processed, rapid crew vocals trade off for a menacing, brutal texture.

# hardcore_pop - Sintikkajzerica_dr_Khans_1
[DESCRIPTION]
The track is a high-energy hip-hop piece with a driving beat and a prominent synth melody. The tempo is fast, creating an urgent and exciting atmosphere. The instrumentation includes a powerful drum machine providing a consistent, punchy rhythm, a deep bassline that underpins the harmonic structure, and a lead synthesizer playing a catchy, repetitive melody. The vocals are delivered by a male rapper with a clear, confident tone, utilizing a rhythmic flow that complements the instrumental track. The production is clean and modern, with a strong emphasis on the beat and synth hooks. The song structure follows a typical verse-chorus format, with the chorus featuring a more anthemic feel due to the layered synth elements. The overall mix is bright and dynamic, with the vocals sitting prominently in the foreground.

[LYRICS]
[Track]-[Fast dark street hip-hop/drill,~140BPM,full drums from bar1,no soft intro.Hard punchy drum-machine kick,bright snare,sharp 1/8–1/16 hats,occasional stutters.Deep sub-bass glued to kick with mild distortion,following bounce of vocals.Repetitive catchy synth hook(pitched bells/pluck)wide in stereo,plus low pad for glue.Mix bright,modern,club-ready,master around-7 to-6 LUFS,aggressive but clear.]

[Structure]-[No long intro:short FX lead-in→Male1 long verse(one-take cypher feel,beat constant)→short hook-like breathing bar(if needed,just beat+ad-libs)→Male2 verse→spoken/radio-outro with noise+static.]

[Vocals-Male1]-[Deep-mid male,gritty but controlled,close-mic,fast bounce,rhythmic Serbian drill flow.Compression 4:1–6:1,fast attack,medium release,subtle tape/tube saturation,plate verb 8–10%,short slap delay only on selected punchlines.No autotune artifacts,only light correction.]

[Vocals-Male2]-[Similar tone but slightly higher energy,more ad-libs around lines,occasional stereo doubles on ends.Reverb slightly shorter,delay used more for call/response.Overall level matched to Male1(+/-0.5dB).]

[FX]-[All SFX tight to grid,sidechained slightly to kick.Never overpower vocal,used as rhythmic punctuation and scene-setting.Decay short–medium,stereo placement varies per effect.]

# hardcore_pop - Sintikkajzerica_dr_Khans_2
[DESCRIPTION]
The Serbian drill track opens at 100 BPM: deep, muffled kicks, distant snare/clap, sparse hats, and long sub notes set an ominous mood. Shakers and tighter hats build, with off-beat percussive synth stabs introducing a 90s Euro-reggae pop bounce. Rising to 135 BPM, sliding 808s and clipped, distorted bass hit with aggressive, stuttering hats and punchy percussion for peak intensity. Sparse, sharp melodic hooks cut through, while rapid, processed crew vocals trade off for a menacing texture. The outro strips to airy hats and a clean clap, shifting toward a lighter, hopeful feel.

# hardcore_pop - Sintikkajzerica_dr_Khans_2
[DESCRIPTION]
The track is a high-energy hip-hop piece with a driving beat and a prominent synth melody. The tempo is fast, creating an urgent and exciting atmosphere. The instrumentation includes a powerful drum machine providing a consistent, punchy rhythm, a deep bassline that underpins the harmonic structure, and a lead synthesizer playing a catchy, repetitive melody. The vocals are delivered by a male rapper with a clear, confident tone, utilizing a rhythmic flow that complements the instrumental track. The production is clean and modern, with a strong emphasis on the beat and synth hooks. The song structure follows a typical verse-chorus format, with the chorus featuring a more anthemic feel due to the layered synth elements. The overall mix is bright and dynamic, with the vocals sitting prominently in the foreground.

[LYRICS]
[Track]-[Serbian drill hybrid:starts 100BPM dark/ominous with deep muffled kicks,distant snare/clap,long subs,sparse hats.Building shakers+offbeat percussive synth stabs add 90s Euro-reggae bounce.BPM ramps→135BPM with sliding 808s,clipped/distorted bass,aggressive stuttering hats and sharp percussion.Sparse bright hooks cut through.Crew-style split-panned vocals.Outro drops to airy hats+clean clap,hopeful feel.]

[Structure]-[100BPM intro→Male1 long verse(with BPM ramp)→short bounce bar(if needed)→Male2 verse at 135BPM→spoken/radio-outro with airy perc+static.]

[Vocals-Male1]-[Close,gritty.100BPM:light tunnel verb.As tempo rises:comp 4:1–6:1,short slap on punches,light widen.No obvious autotune.]

[Vocals-Male2]-[Sharper,more ad-libs.Split-panned doubles+shouts.Delay on ends,slight peak dist.]

[FX]-[Synced to tempo+transitions.Sweeps for BPM ramp,stabs for bounce,glitches for drill.Sidechained to kick,always under lead.]

# hardcore_pop - Sintikkajzerica_dr_Khans_2
[DESCRIPTION]
The track is a high-energy hip-hop piece with a driving beat and a prominent synth melody. The tempo is fast, creating an urgent and exciting atmosphere. The instrumentation includes a powerful drum machine providing a consistent, punchy rhythm, a deep bassline that underpins the harmonic structure, and a lead synthesizer playing a catchy, repetitive melody. The vocals are delivered by a male rapper with a clear, confident tone, utilizing a rhythmic flow that complements the instrumental track. The production is clean and modern, with a strong emphasis on the beat and synth hooks. The song structure follows a typical verse-chorus format, with the chorus featuring a more anthemic feel due to the layered synth elements. The overall mix is bright and dynamic, with the vocals sitting prominently in the foreground.

# hardcore_pop - Sintikkajzerica_dr_Khans_2
[DESCRIPTION]
The Serbian drill track opens at 100 BPM: deep, muffled kicks, distant snare/clap, sparse hats, and long sub notes set an ominous mood. Shakers and tighter hats build, with off-beat percussive synth stabs introducing a 90s Euro-reggae pop bounce. Rising to 135 BPM, sliding 808s and clipped, distorted bass hit with aggressive, stuttering hats and punchy percussion for peak intensity. Sparse, sharp melodic hooks cut through, while rapid, processed crew vocals trade off for a menacing texture. The outro strips to airy hats and a clean clap, shifting toward a lighter, hopeful feel.

[LYRICS]
[Track]-[Serbian drill hybrid:starts 100BPM dark/ominous with deep muffled kicks,distant snare/clap,long subs,sparse hats.Building shakers+offbeat percussive synth stabs add 90s Euro-reggae bounce.BPM ramps→135BPM with sliding 808s,clipped/distorted bass,aggressive stuttering hats and sharp percussion.Sparse bright hooks cut through.Crew-style split-panned vocals.Outro drops to airy hats+clean clap,hopeful feel.]

[Structure]-[100BPM intro→Male1 long verse(with BPM ramp)→short bounce bar(if needed)→Male2 verse at 135BPM→spoken/radio-outro with airy perc+static.]

[Vocals-Male1]-[Close,gritty.100BPM:light tunnel verb.As tempo rises:comp 4:1–6:1,short slap on punches,light widen.No obvious autotune.]

[Vocals-Male2]-[Sharper,more ad-libs.Split-panned doubles+shouts.Delay on ends,slight peak dist.]

[FX]-[Synced to tempo+transitions.Sweeps for BPM ramp,stabs for bounce,glitches for drill.Sidechained to kick,always under lead.]

# hardcore_pop - Sintikkajzerica_dr_Khans_2
[DESCRIPTION]
The track is a high-energy hip-hop piece with a driving beat and a prominent synth melody. The tempo is fast, creating an urgent and exciting atmosphere. The instrumentation includes a powerful drum machine providing a consistent, punchy rhythm, a deep bassline that underpins the harmonic structure, and a lead synthesizer playing a catchy, repetitive melody. The vocals are delivered by a male rapper with a clear, confident tone, utilizing a rhythmic flow that complements the instrumental track. The production is clean and modern, with a strong emphasis on the beat and synth hooks. The song structure follows a typical verse-chorus format, with the chorus featuring a more anthemic feel due to the layered synth elements. The overall mix is bright and dynamic, with the vocals sitting prominently in the foreground.

[LYRICS]
[Track]-[Fast dark street hip-hop/drill,~140BPM,full drums from bar1,no soft intro.Hard punchy drum-machine kick,bright snare,sharp 1/8–1/16 hats,occasional stutters.Deep sub-bass glued to kick with mild distortion,following bounce of vocals.Repetitive catchy synth hook(pitched bells/pluck)wide in stereo,plus low pad for glue.Mix bright,modern,club-ready,master around-7 to-6 LUFS,aggressive but clear.]

[Structure]-[No long intro:short FX lead-in→Male1 long verse(one-take cypher feel,beat constant)→short hook-like breathing bar(if needed,just beat+ad-libs)→Male2 verse→spoken/radio-outro with noise+static.]

[Vocals-Male1]-[Deep-mid male,gritty but controlled,close-mic,fast bounce,rhythmic Serbian drill flow.Compression 4:1–6:1,fast attack,medium release,subtle tape/tube saturation,plate verb 8–10%,short slap delay only on selected punchlines.No autotune artifacts,only light correction.]

[Vocals-Male2]-[Similar tone but slightly higher energy,more ad-libs around lines,occasional stereo doubles on ends.Reverb slightly shorter,delay used more for call/response.Overall level matched to Male1(+/-0.5dB).]

[FX]-[All SFX tight to grid,sidechained slightly to kick.Never overpower vocal,used as rhythmic punctuation and scene-setting.Decay short–medium,stereo placement varies per effect.]

# hardcore_pop - Sintikkajzerica_dr_Khans_2 (Edit) (Edit) (Edit)
[DESCRIPTION]
The Serbian drill track opens at 100 BPM: deep, muffled kicks, distant snare/clap, sparse hats, and long sub notes set an ominous mood. Shakers and tighter hats build, with off-beat percussive synth stabs introducing a 90s Euro-reggae pop bounce. Rising to 135 BPM, sliding 808s and clipped, distorted bass hit with aggressive, stuttering hats and punchy percussion for peak intensity. Sparse, sharp melodic hooks cut through, while rapid, processed crew vocals trade off for a menacing texture. The outro strips to airy hats and a clean clap, shifting toward a lighter, hopeful feel.

# hardcore_pop - Sintikkajzerica_dr_Khans_3
[DESCRIPTION]
A high-energy Serbian drill banger around 135 BPM that fuses classic funk-sample bounce with modern street aggression. Layered, swung breakbeats and stuttering hi-hats lock in with sliding, clipped 808s and distorted sub, creating a raw, driving low-end. Chopped, EQ’d funk-style synth riffs and high-pitched lead lines act as the main hook, with sparse, fragmented motifs answering the drums. The groove is syncopated but tight: sharp snares, ghost kicks, and percussive chops keep constant forward motion. Intensely processed crew vocals—short, rhythmic shouts and chant-style phrases—are treated almost like percussion, cutting through the dense yet clean mix with a menacing, brutal texture.

# hardcore_pop - Sintikkajzerica_dr_Khans_3
[DESCRIPTION]
A high-energy Serbian drill banger around 135 BPM that fuses classic funk-sample bounce with modern street aggression. Layered, swung breakbeats and stuttering hi-hats lock in with sliding, clipped 808s and distorted sub, creating a raw, driving low-end. Chopped, EQ’d funk-style synth riffs and high-pitched lead lines act as the main hook, with sparse, fragmented motifs answering the drums. The groove is syncopated but tight: sharp snares, ghost kicks, and percussive chops keep constant forward motion. Intensely processed crew vocals—short, rhythmic shouts and chant-style phrases—are treated almost like percussion, cutting through the dense yet clean mix with a menacing, brutal texture.

# hardcore_pop - Sintikkajzerica_dr_Khans_4
[DESCRIPTION]
The instrumental builds on layered funk and hip-hop samples, driven by breakbeats like “Impeach the President” and “Escape-Ism.” The drums are swung, with sharp snares, busy 16th-note hi-hats, and syncopated kicks. The hook comes from the Ohio Players’ “Funky Worm,” supplying a high-pitched synth lead and bouncy bassline, supported by elements from Jackson 5’s “I Want You Back.” Samples are EQ’d, chopped, and looped for cohesion, with tight, punchy mixing. The structure is verse–chorus–verse with chant-driven hooks and no breakdowns. The sonic texture is dense yet clear: centered drums and bass, bright highs, and subtle stereo panning. Compression and mix clarity keep energy high. Despite the chaotic sample layering, the beat feels clean, direct, and catchy—funky with a raw, driving bounce.
jump jump kris kross

# hardcore_pop - Sintikkajzerica_dr_Khans_4
[DESCRIPTION]
The instrumental builds on layered funk and hip-hop samples, driven by breakbeats like “Impeach the President” and “Escape-Ism.” The drums are swung, with sharp snares, busy 16th-note hi-hats, and syncopated kicks. The hook comes from the Ohio Players’ “Funky Worm,” supplying a high-pitched synth lead and bouncy bassline, supported by elements from Jackson 5’s “I Want You Back.” Samples are EQ’d, chopped, and looped for cohesion, with tight, punchy mixing. The structure is verse–chorus–verse with chant-driven hooks and no breakdowns. The sonic texture is dense yet clear: centered drums and bass, bright highs, and subtle stereo panning. Compression and mix clarity keep energy high. Despite the chaotic sample layering, the beat feels clean, direct, and catchy—funky with a raw, driving bounce.

# hardcore_pop - Sintikkajzerica_dr_Khans_4
[DESCRIPTION]
The Serbian drill track opens at 100 BPM: deep, muffled kicks, distant snare/clap, sparse hats, and long sub notes set an ominous mood. Shakers and tighter hats build, with off-beat percussive synth stabs introducing a 90s Euro-reggae pop bounce. Rising to 135 BPM, sliding 808s and clipped, distorted bass hit with aggressive, stuttering hats and punchy percussion for peak intensity. Sparse, sharp melodic hooks cut through, while rapid, processed crew vocals trade off for a menacing texture. The outro strips to airy hats and a clean clap, shifting toward a lighter, hopeful feel.

# hardcore_pop - Sintikkajzerica_dr_Khans_5
[DESCRIPTION]
Dark, driving Serbian drill opens with chopped urgent Balkan folk samples over booming 808s and syncopated trap hats. Gritty synth stabs and biting snares fuel relentless verses. Strategic drops pull focus to eerie Eastern European motifs, then surge back into dense, aggressive percussion.

# hardcore_pop - Sintikkajzerica_dr_Khans_5
[DESCRIPTION]
Dark, driving Serbian drill opens with chopped urgent Balkan folk samples over booming 808s and syncopated trap hats. Gritty synth stabs and biting snares fuel relentless verses. Strategic drops pull focus to eerie Eastern European motifs, then surge back into dense, aggressive percussion.

# hardcore_pop - SIrotiljecca_Ficco_Cassio x Shemsa
[DESCRIPTION]
A vintage Balkan folk-pop ballad built on a slow, steady rhythm with warm analog tones and a melancholic, story-driven mood. The arrangement centers on a soft, rounded kick and light snare accents, supported by a gentle electric-bass line that moves in simple, emotional patterns. A bright, reverb-washed accordion carries the main harmonic color, weaving expressive lines over a bed of sustained synth pads typical of late-80s production. Occasional ornamental leads and string-like layers add dramatic shading. The vocals are dominant, raw, and deeply expressive, sitting forward in the mix with a slight tape-saturation warmth. The overall atmosphere is sorrowful, reflective, and intimate, with the instrumental serving mostly as a supportive emotional backdrop rather than a rhythmic driver. The track feels nostalgic, mournful, and human, built entirely around storytelling and vocal emotion.

[LYRICS]
[Verse 1]
I came up years ago under a leaking roof of tin,
Broken walls and winter wind, no one ever asked me in.
Mama’s eyes were tired glass, father’s hands were shaking stone,
To their empty table, I was just one more mouth to own.

Same four corners, same old night, echoes dripping from the sky,
Hand-me-downs and cheap regrets, silence louder than a cry.
Two worn shadows in the dark, counting debts instead of dreams,
I was just the extra weight stitched inside their busted seams.

[Chorus]
Now I don’t blame my father, I don’t blame my mother,
I just see how this life turns us against each other.
Poverty’s a poison, makes hearts break and divide,
Even love goes missing when the hunger’s in your eyes.

Now I don’t blame my father, I don’t blame my mother,
It’s the cold of this world that made us hurt each other.
Poverty’s a siren in a war on the inside,
Even love stops breathing when the hope runs dry.

[Verse 2]
Heard their voices in the night, every word a shattered glass,
Crying quiet in the corner, wishing all of it would pass.
I swore I hated both of them, swore I’d never be the same,
Never knew the way this city writes its scars into your name.

Bills like knives upon the floor, fear like metal in the air,
Two lost souls that never had a real chance to be fair.
Took me years to see the truth buried under all that noise:
It was hunger, not their hearts, turning love into a void.

[Chorus]
Now I don’t blame my father, I don’t blame my mother,
I just see how this life turns us against each other.
Poverty’s a poison, makes hearts break and divide,
Even love goes missing when the hunger’s in your eyes.

Now I don’t blame my father, I don’t blame my mother,
It’s the cold of this world that made us hurt each other.
Poverty’s a siren in a war on the inside,
Even love stops breathing when the hope runs dry.

---

# hardcore_pop - SIrotiljecca_Ficco_Cassio x Shemsa
[DESCRIPTION]
A vintage Balkan folk-pop ballad built on a slow, steady rhythm with warm analog tones and a melancholic, story-driven mood. The arrangement centers on a soft, rounded kick and light snare accents, supported by a gentle electric-bass line that moves in simple, emotional patterns. A bright, reverb-washed accordion carries the main harmonic color, weaving expressive lines over a bed of sustained synth pads typical of late-80s production. Occasional ornamental leads and string-like layers add dramatic shading. The vocals are dominant, raw, and deeply expressive, sitting forward in the mix with a slight tape-saturation warmth. The overall atmosphere is sorrowful, reflective, and intimate, with the instrumental serving mostly as a supportive emotional backdrop rather than a rhythmic driver. The track feels nostalgic, mournful, and human, built entirely around storytelling and vocal emotion.

[LYRICS]
[Verse 1]

I was born many years ago
Beneath an old, poor roof
To a poor father and mother
To them I was another burden and worry
I was born many years ago
Beneath an old, poor roof
To a poor father and mother
To them I was another burden and worry

[Chorus]

Now I don’t blame my father or my mother
Only now I see what life truly is
Poverty makes people fight
And even love fades then
Now I don’t blame my father or my mother
Only now I see what life truly is
Poverty makes people fight
And even love fades then

[Verse 2]

I often listened to their arguments
Crying quietly in the corner of the room
I hated both my father and my mother
I didn’t know the real truth
I often listened to their arguments
Crying quietly in the corner of the room
I hated both my father and my mother
I didn’t know the real truth

[Chorus]

Only now I see what life truly is
Poverty makes people fight
And even love fades then
Now I don’t blame my father or my mother
Only now I see what life truly is
Poverty makes people fight

# hardcore_pop - SIrotiljecca_Ficco_Cassio x Shemsa
[DESCRIPTION]
A dynamic underground slap-club oriental pop anthem that fuses Balkan nostalgia with modern dance-floor energy. The groove is nonstop: punchy kicks, tight snares, bouncing percussion, and a rolling bassline that keeps the rhythm alive. Zurna leads cut through the mix with sharp Eastern phrasing, joined by gusle drones, warm 80s-style MIDI synth chords, and vintage organs adding retro grit. Car honks, tire screeches, and urban FX give it street-level attitude. The melodic palette blends Turkish scales with Balkan ornamentation, creating a hypnotic, high-tension atmosphere. Smooth, silk-clear vocals—no autotune, just pure tone—carry the emotional core, floating above the driving beat. The result is a vibrant, cinematic, dance-forward hybrid: part oriental club heater, part retro folk-pop memory, part underground rave anthem.

[LYRICS]
[Verse 1]
I came up years ago under a leaking roof of tin,
Broken walls and winter wind, no one ever asked me in.
Mama’s eyes were tired glass, father’s hands were shaking stone,
To their empty table, I was just one more mouth to own.

Same four corners, same old night, echoes dripping from the sky,
Hand-me-downs and cheap regrets, silence louder than a cry.
Two worn shadows in the dark, counting debts instead of dreams,
I was just the extra weight stitched inside their busted seams.

[Chorus]
Now I don’t blame my father, I don’t blame my mother,
I just see how this life turns us against each other.
Poverty’s a poison, makes hearts break and divide,
Even love goes missing when the hunger’s in your eyes.

Now I don’t blame my father, I don’t blame my mother,
It’s the cold of this world that made us hurt each other.
Poverty’s a siren in a war on the inside,
Even love stops breathing when the hope runs dry.

[Verse 2]
Heard their voices in the night, every word a shattered glass,
Crying quiet in the corner, wishing all of it would pass.
I swore I hated both of them, swore I’d never be the same,
Never knew the way this city writes its scars into your name.

Bills like knives upon the floor, fear like metal in the air,
Two lost souls that never had a real chance to be fair.
Took me years to see the truth buried under all that noise:
It was hunger, not their hearts, turning love into a void.

[Chorus]
Now I don’t blame my father, I don’t blame my mother,
I just see how this life turns us against each other.
Poverty’s a poison, makes hearts break and divide,
Even love goes missing when the hunger’s in your eyes.

Now I don’t blame my father, I don’t blame my mother,
It’s the cold of this world that made us hurt each other.
Poverty’s a siren in a war on the inside,
Even love stops breathing when the hope runs dry.

---

([echo] - "leti, poleti")
Leti u paranoje
([flanger] - "paranoje")
A-a-a sve bi dao ja tebi
([chopped] - "a-a-a")
Bejbi sve je to tvoje
([delay] - "bejbi, tvoje")
Ko leti bi da poleti
([echo] - "poleti")
Leti u paranoje
([reverb] - "paranoje, noje")

[Verse 2]
Um mi poremetila
([echo] - "poremetila")
Zapalila me, pa odletela
([reverb] - "odletela")
A vidi mila, ima debila
([chopped] - "mila, debila")
Tako dobra ti si, zašto bi se krila
([delay] - "zašto bi se krila")

Opet hoće da mi te ukradu
([echo] - "ukradu, ukradu")
Al ne dam nikom noćas moju malu
([reverb] - "moju malu")
Ništa sitno, dolare donesi mi do stana
([chopped] - "dolare, do stana")
Od tebe sam bio kako tako lako mala pada
([flanger] - "pada, pada")
Al nada čemu li se nada
([echo] - "nada, nada")
Ja sada daleko od grada
([reverb] - "daleko od grada")

([chopped] - "a-a-a, sebi dao")

# hardcore_pop - Skkini Bikkini_Hardcore_Pop_4
[DESCRIPTION]
at 120-125 bpm bouncy reggaetón  club tech Balkan zurne, cathederal organ, echo, oriental pop, church choir, ancient lute, ancient lyre, car honks, tire screeching, dynamic, dance non-stop groove paired with silk smooth voices, no autotune, just clear vocals. Female back vocal, male vocals

[LYRICS]
[Intro]
A gde si bila ti
([echo] - "gde si bila ti")
O moja mila i
([reverb] - "moja mila")
A sve se krila mi
([chopped] - "krila, krila")
Lovim te, po-mah-ni-tah ti
([flanger] - "po-mah-ni-tah ti")

[Chorus]
A sve bi dao ja tebi
([echo] - "dao ja tebi")
Bejbi sve je to tvoje
([reverb] - "bejbi, tvoje")
Ko leti bi da poleti
([chopped] - "leti, poleti")
Leti u paranoje
([delay] - "paranoje, paranoje")

[Verse 1]
Ala- la laganini
([echo] - "laganini")
Skini bikini, desno nazad
([chopped] - "skini-bikini")
U krivini ruka na butini
([reverb] - "na butini")
Ona pala na mene vidi mili
([delay] - "pala na mene")
kako živim
([flanger] - "živim, živim")
O lalala ko čokolada sve sa sebe skini
([echo] - "lalala, čokolada")

Dodji kući ranije
([reverb] - "ranije")
Ne znam sta se dešava
([chopped] - "de-ša-va")
Ona flaša rakije
([echo] - "rakije, rakije")
Spremna da se rešava
([delay] - "rešava, rešava")

[Chorus]
A-a-a sve bi dao ja tebi
([chopped] - "a-a-a, dao ja tebi")
Bejbi sve je to tvoje
([reverb] - "sve je tvoje")
Ko leti bi da poleti
([echo] - "leti, poleti")
Leti u paranoje
([flanger] - "paranoje")
A-a-a sve bi dao ja tebi
([chopped] - "a-a-a")
Bejbi sve je to tvoje
([delay] - "bejbi, tvoje")
Ko leti bi da poleti
([echo] - "poleti")
Leti u paranoje
([reverb] - "paranoje, noje")

[Verse 2]

([echo] - "poremetila")

([reverb] - "odletela")

# hardcore_pop - Skkini Bikkini_Hardcore_Pop_6
[DESCRIPTION]
A trap track launches with rapid hi-hats and booming 808s, driven by a chopped and pitched vocal sample echoing the iconic “jump jump” motif over bouncing synth stabs. The verses hinge on sparse percussion and deep sub-bass, while the hook intensifies with layered synths, powerful snares, and energetic call-and-response effects punctuating the rhythm. The bridge introduces a filtered breakdown, then builds back to a dynamic, club-ready drop.

[LYRICS]
[Intro]
A gde si bila ti
([echo] - "gde si bila ti")
O moja mila i
([reverb] - "moja mila")
A sve se krila mi
([chopped] - "krila, krila")

([flanger] - "po-mah-ni-tah ti")

([reverb] - "bejbi, tvoje")

([chopped] - "leti, poleti")
Leti u paranoje
([delay] - "paranoje, paranoje")

[Verse 1]

# hardcore_pop - Skock_u_Dubinu_3_Hardcore_Pop
[DESCRIPTION]
At 135 bpm, this tech house cut launches with hypnotic zurle-inspired synths, swirling above a deep kick. Jungle and organ chops slice through busy polyrhythmic congas, while chopped vocals and quirky found-sound hits drive shifting rhythms. 80s synth textures add lush, retro warmth.

# hardcore_pop - Skock_u_Dubinu_Hardcore_Pop
[DESCRIPTION]
This 135 bpm tech house track ignites with jagged metallic percussion, rapid rimshots, and offbeat woodblock layers for intricate movement. A driving, saturated bass anchors darting monosynths and Eastern brass stabs that spiral across the stereo field. The breakdown strips to melodious Rhodes chords and serpentine synth pads, blooming into a peak section where syncopated conga loops, frenetic chopped vox FX, and percussive found sounds build density, pushing energy through dynamic drops and relentless rhythmic interplay.

[LYRICS]

volim i bejs

# hardcore_pop - Slap - Hardcore_Pop_1
[DESCRIPTION]
pulsating sultry bouncy undeground Balkan slap club tech Turkish oriental pop ,  car honks, tire screeching, dynamic, dance non-stop groove paired with silk smooth voices, no autotune, just clear vocals

[LYRICS]
[Intro - Minimal beat, finger snaps, distant car horn]
[Conversational, relaxed vocal delivery]
All of my friends
Always over on the weekend
Always chillin' in the deep end (Yeah)
[Beat builds - add kick drum]
Yeah
We just came here to dance
Wanna dance? (Yeah, yeah!)
[Verse 1 - Full beat drops, bouncy bassline, darbuka rhythm]
[Confident, slightly breathy delivery]
I've got a couple of things I could tell you (Tell you)
I've got a couple of ways I could help you (Help you)
[Add synth stabs]
I've got a couple of drinks I could sell you (Sell you)
I've got a couple of ways I could smell you (Smell you)
[Build tension - filter sweep]
I've got a couple of rooms in my house (In my house)
[Drop - heavy bass hit]
I've got a couple of things I could do to you
(do to you, do to you)
[Layered vocal chop]
I've got a couple of friends I could introduce you to
(introduce you, introduce you)
[Repeat section - add percussion layers]
I've got a couple of rooms in my house
I've got a couple of things I could do to you
(do to you, do to you)
I've got a couple of friends I could introduce you to
(introduce you, introduce you)
[Pre-Chorus Build - rising synth, tire screech sample]
[Chorus - Maximum energy, car horn accents on "slap"]
[Powerful, commanding vocals]
I love it when you do that
Do that, do that, do that
[Horn stabs synchronized]
Slap, slap, slap, slap, slap, slap, slap
[Repeat pattern 3x with varying intensity]
[Verse 2 - Strip down to groove, add Turkish synth lead]
[More intimate vocal tone]
I got a couple of things I could tell you
(tell you, tell you)
[Build gradually]
I got a couple of ways I could help you
(help you, help you)
[Add claps]
I got a couple of drinks I could sell you
(sell you, sell you)
I got a couple of ways I could smell you
(smell you, smell you)
[Full build - all elements]
I got a couple of rooms in my house (In my house)
[Explosive drop]
I got a couple of things I could do to you
(do to you, do to you)
I got a couple of friends I could introduce you to
(introduce you, introduce you)
[Final Chorus - Peak energy, all layers, ad-libs]
[Outro - Gradual fadeout with vocal echoes]

# hardcore_pop - Slap - Hardcore_Pop_3
[DESCRIPTION]
pulsating sultry bouncy underground Balkan slap club tech Turkish oriental pop. Clear, unprocessed human vocals - NO autotune. Silk smooth delivery with conversational confidence. Natural breathing, slight imperfections. Dynamic range from breathy intimate verses to powerful commanding chorus. Add spontaneous ad-libs, vocal runs, and call-response patterns.
Non-stop dance groove, syncopated Balkan beats, darbuka percussion layers. Bouncy bassline with Turkish synth leads. Finger snaps, hand claps.
Car horn stabs synchronized with "slap" vocals. Tire screech transitions. Filter sweeps, risers. Heavy bass drops. Synth chops and stabs. Build-ups with tension, explosive drops. Layered percussion (kicks, snares, hi-hats with slight timing variations for human feel).
Dynamic arrangement - minimal intro building to full energy. Strip down verses, massive chorus. Gradual intensity increase throughout.Use silence/pause
Humanize timing slightly, natural phrasing, spatial stereo effects,authentic

[LYRICS]
[Intro - Minimal beat, finger snaps, distant car horn]
[Conversational, relaxed vocal delivery]

Always over on the weekend

# hardcore_pop - Soja Djiki DESETKOM I DAMOM _dr_Khans
[DESCRIPTION]
An aggressive Serbian street hip-hop track at 110 BPM, anchored by a pounding 808 kick, thick saturated bass, and a machine-tight drum groove with piercing hats and a snappy snare. Melancholic pads and a minimal high synth float on wide stereo, contrasting a raw, barked baritone vocal, which is forcefully compressed and saturated for cut and presence. The dense, centered rhythm foundation collides with icy spatial textures, delivering a cold, urban confessional feel. Vocal effects are minimal—just tight plate and sharp slapback throws on select phrases.

[LYRICS]
[Verse 1]
Nama chopper je u studiju,
([adlib] - „chop-chop“)
pa malo jači flex
([delay] - „flex… flex…“)
Njene gole noge uviju,
([BV low] - „mmm…“)
pa malo jači sex
([reverb] - „jači sex…“)
Voli crnu metalurgiju
([FX grime] - „clang-clang“)
kad pati kalim bes
([growl] - „grrr…“)
U Audiju burgiju balavila ko pez
([engine rev] - vrrrroom)
Bezvez kez, dental sticks,
([chopped] - „kez-kez“)
bezveze, tims and tricks
([adlib] - „tricks… tricks…“)
Ko Vaskez, muscle build,
([BV gang] - „muscle, muscle“)
njima ide spomenik,
([echo] - „spomenik…“)
Pa polis (fucking flece)
([siren distant] - wiiiu-wiiiu)
Flight to Swiss, money moves
([cash FX] - „shhhh“)
Give me please, dobar niz, u biznisu Dibidus
([tapestop] - „di-bi-dus…“)

[Chorus]
Rani sati jutarnji,
([pad rise] - whoooom)
dižemo se skupa,
([gang BV] - „skupa, skupa“)
Ekipa prava, srcem jaka grupa
([chant] - „u-u-uuu“)
kad je dobro i kad nije
([echo] - „kad nije…“)
Držimo se zajedno,
([BV] - „zajedno…“)
uzori ulice, nadahnuti pravdom
([street FX] - distant traffic)
Sunce se rađa, ceo grad još spava
([soft BV] - „spava…“)
Mi na nogama, uveliko bistra glava
([head nod FX] - tkk)
Da bi biznis bio strava, mora da se radi
([chant] - „radi, radi…“)
Nema zastoja, zlato se iz blata vadi
([FX shovel] - shkrr)
Ko ti je u životu nek razume ko i shvati
([spoken BV] - „razumi, shvati…“)
Da bi danas znao ovo prvo mora da se pati
([delay] - „mora da se pati…“)
Onda presek stanja, činjenica se prihvati
([BV] - „prihvati…“)
Pa kud koji mili moj ' koliko ko sebi zahvati
([crowd murmur] - „ey, ey…“)

[Verse 2]
To je petak, kriva slika,
([FX camera] - click)
vama smešna svaka spika,
([chopped] - „spika-spika“)
Moj je Šoja, bratska dika,
([gang chant] - „Šo-ja!“)
metak primam za tog lika
([gun cock FX, low] - chk)
Ide hajp, u gađanju prvi
([adlib] - „hajp, hajp…“)
to je taktika
([echo] - „taktika…“)

[Instrumental Chops]
([scratch] - krk-krk)
([glitch vox] - „hey! hey!“)
([bass stab] - boom)

[Verse 3]
Moje srce lupa, lupa, ono tera 200 pumpa
([heartbeat FX] - thump-thump-thump)
Dobra nestane, koliko grama na metama smo mupa
([sirena daleko] - wiiiu)
Ova upala mi usta, njena usta cela buksna
([adlib] - „buksna…“)
A telo ti kao fuksa i belo  iz Beneluksa
([FX] - „beneluks… lux…“)

Putem do uspeha svi kažu nije lako
([spoken BV] - „nije lako…“)
Prave se pametni, al niko ne zna kako
([crowd] - „kako, kako…“)
Ovako il onako znam da boriću se jako
([chant] - „jako! jako!“)
Ustajanje rano, vožnja samo desnom stranom
([engine low] - vrrr)
Ubijanje sebe, tako dan za danom
([clock FX] - tik-tak)
Kao na zadatku tajnom dok ne pronađeš taj šablon
([whisper] - „tajno… šablon…“)
Odavno shvatio da nije sve sjajno i bajno
([BV] - „nije bajno…“)
Borim se za mesto koje će mi biti trajno
([echo] - „trajno… trajno…“)

[Chorus]

([card FX] - shuffle)

([chip FX] - clack)

([adlib] - „tamo-vamo…“)

([FX dark pad] - whooom)

[Verse 4]
Šole čakija golema, pada belo sad za pola
([knife FX] - shing)
Čuda mafija problema kada gejam punim borac
([phone buzz] - bzzz)
Krijem se, izmičem,
([echo] - „izmičem… izmičem…“)
dok pokušavam da shvatim igru
([BV low] - „igru…“)
Sklanjam se od svakog zla da bi spavao na miru
([sigh] - haaah)
Jedno bez drugog ne ide,
kao dirke na klaviru,
([piano FX] - pling-pling)
kao lav (borim se)
([growl] - rrrr)
da se ne udavim u viru.
([water FX] - shhhhlosh)

---

# hardcore_pop - Soja Djiki DESETKOM I DAMOM _dr_Khans
[DESCRIPTION]
A dark, high-impact Balkan street anthem built on a slower, chest-heavy drill/trap hybrid beat at ~132–136 BPM. The groove hits harder and breathes more: a weighty, punchy kick drives a thick sliding 808 that ducks under sidechain and moves with more space in the 40–80 Hz range. The snare stays short and clipped, locking tightly with hats that pulse in 1/8 and open into slower 1/16 rolls and sparse switch-ups. Metallic grime hits and foley FX (sirens, engines, shovels, cards) accent the storytelling without overcrowding. The vocal is a deep, gritty Serbian baritone delivered with controlled aggression, dry and forward, with wide gang layers boosting key moments. Verses are dense and cinematic, while choruses open with pads, chants, and wider ambience. The mix remains loud but clean (-7.5 to -7 LUFS), with a focused mono low-end, smooth polished highs, and transitions built with tapestops, scratches, and rising FX—fully club-ready yet spacious and heavy.

[LYRICS]
[GlobalMix–Modern Serbian drill/trap ~140 BPM.Dark heavy low-end, tight punchy kick(55–80 Hz),short transient.Snare/clap sharp with 4–7 kHz crack.808 long slides,mono <120 Hz,sidechained 3 dB.Hats:1/8 pulse,1/16 fills,occasional triplets.HPF hats >300 Hz.Perc metallic grime stabs,foley FX(sirens,engines,cards,camera,knife,water),always tempo-locked.Vocals:deep gritty baritone,controlled aggression,sharp consonants,tight proximity,presence 3–5 kHz,light saturation,de-ess 6–8 kHz.Mains mostly dry;slapback for ad-libs;reverb only on throws.Chorus wider with pads/gang BVs.Master:-7.5 to -7 LUFS,clean transient headroom,brickwall -0.8 dB.]

[Intro–4 bars filtered drums+808,low pad,siren swell into Verse 1.]

[Verse1- Serbian]
Nama chopper je u studiju,
([adlib]-„chop-chop“;dry slapback)
pa malo jači flex
([delay]-„flex…flex…“;1/4 pingpong)
Njene gole noge uviju,
([BVlow]-„mmm…“;warm stereo)
pa malo jači sex
([reverb]-„jači sex…“;throw)
Voli crnu metalurgiju
([FXgrime]-„clang-clang“;metal hit)
kad pati kalim bes
([growl]-„grrr…“;low grit)
U Audiju burgiju balavila ko pez
([engine rev]-vrrroom;bar riser)
Bezvez kez,dental sticks,
([chopped]-„kez-kez“;1/8 stutter)
bezveze,tims and tricks
([adlib]-„tricks…“;wide delay)
Ko Vaskez,muscle build,
([BVgang]-„muscle,muscle“;L/R)
njima ide spomenik,
([echo]-„spomenik…“;1/2 dub)
Pa polis(fucking flece)
([siren distant]-wiiiu)
Flight to Swiss,money moves
([cash FX]-„shhhh“)
Give me please,dobar niz,u biznisu Dibidus
([tapestop]-„di-bi-dus…“;bar stop)

[Chorus-Serbian]
Rani sati jutarnji,
([pad rise]-whooom)
dižemo se skupa,
([gang BV]-„skupa“)
Ekipa prava,srcem jaka grupa
([chant]-„u-u-uuu“)
kad je dobro i kad nije
([echo]-„kad nije…“)
Držimo se zajedno,
([BV]-„zajedno…“)
uzori ulice,nadahnuti pravdom
([streetFX]-traffic far)
Sunce se rađa,ceo grad još spava
([softBV]-„spava…“;throw)
Mi na nogama,uveliko bistra glava
([headnod FX]-tkk)
Da bi biznis bio strava,mora da se radi
([chant]-„radi,radi…“)
Nema zastoja,zlato se iz blata vadi
([FXshovel]-shkrr)
Ko ti je u životu nek razume ko i shvati
([spokenBV]-„razumi,shvati…“)
Da bi danas znao ovo prvo mora da se pati
([delay]-„mora da se pati…“)
Onda presek stanja,činjenica se prihvati
([BV]-„prihvati…“)
Pa kud koji mili moj’koliko ko sebi zahvati
([crowdmurmur]-„ey,ey…“)

[Verse2 -Serbian]
To je petak,kriva slika,
([FXcamera]-click)
vama smešna svaka spika,
([chopped]-„spika-spika“;1/16)
Moj je Šoja,bratska dika,
([gangchant]-„Šo-ja!“)
metak primam za tog lika
([guncock]-chk;under snare)
Ide hajp,u gađanju prvi
([adlib]-„hajp…“)
to je taktika
([echo]-„taktika…“)

[InstrumentalChops–4 bars]
([scratch]-krk-krk)
([glitchvox]-„hey!hey!“;pitched)
([bass stab]-boom;808 stab+sub)

[Verse3 -Serbian]
Moje srce lupa,lupa,ono tera 200 pumpa
([heartbeat]-thump-thump)
Dobra nestane,koliko grama na metama smo mupa
([sirena]-wiiiu;filtered)
Ova upala mi usta,njena usta cela buksna
([adlib]-„buksna…“)
A telo ti kao fuksa i belo iz Beneluksa
([FX]-„lux…lux…“)

Putem do uspeha svi kažu nije lako
([spoken]-„nije lako…“)
Prave se pametni,al niko ne zna kako
([crowd]-„kako,kako…“)
Ovako il onako znam da boriću se jako
([chant]-„jako!jako!“)
[chops]
Ustajanje rano,vožnja samo desnom stranom
([engine low]-vrrr)
Ubijanje sebe,tako dan za danom
([clock]-tik-tak;panned)
Kao na zadatku tajnom dok ne pronađeš taj šablon
([whisper]-„tajno…šablon…“;panned)
Odavno shvatio da nije sve sjajno i bajno
([BV]-„nije bajno…“)
Borim se za mesto koje će mi biti trajno
([echo]-„trajno…“)

[Chorus2–slightly wider,heavier FX]
I nude mi dobar talon,započinjem tablom
([cardFX]-shuffle)
Vi tri na karte-duplo,karo desetkom i damom
([chipFX]-clack)
Ko sotona pred Bogom šetam se tamo i vamo
([adlib]-„tamo-vamo…“)
Ne polarizujem sijam,obavijam ih sve tamom
([darkpad]-whooom)

[Vocal chops]

[Verse4 - Serbian]
Šole čakija golema,pada belo sad za pola
([knife]-shing)
Čuda mafija problema kada gejam punim borac
([phone]-bzzz)
Krijem se,izmičem,
([echo]-„izmičem…“)
dok pokušavam da shvatim igru
([BVlow]-„igru…“)
Sklanjam se od svakog zla da bi spavao na miru
([sigh]-haaah)
Jedno bez drugog ne ide,
kao dirke na klaviru,
([piano]-pling)
kao lav(borim se)
([growl]-rrr)
da se ne udavim u viru.
([water]-shhhhlosh)

[Outro–beat filters,808 lowpassed,hats mute,pad+crowd fade,tapestop final bar.]

[Instrumental - go crazy ]

[Mix and Master done expertly]

# hardcore_pop - Soja Djiki DESETKOM I DAMOM _dr_Khans
[DESCRIPTION]
Built on a pounding 110 BPM beat, this Serbian street hip-hop track features dark, punchy 808s, crisp hi-hats, and menacing synth bass. Deep, barked vocals ride the heavy groove. Sparse eastern European melodies cut through the mix, layered with gritty sampled textures and bold drops.

[LYRICS]
[Verse 1]
Nama chopper je u studiju,
([adlib] - „chop-chop“)
pa malo jači flex
([delay] - „flex… flex…“)
Njene gole noge uviju,
([BV low] - „mmm…“)
pa malo jači sex
([reverb] - „jači sex…“)

([FX grime] - „clang-clang“)
kad pati kalim bes
([growl] - „grrr…“)
U Audiju burgiju balavila ko pez
([engine rev] - vrrrroom)
Bezvez kez, dental sticks,
([chopped] - „kez-kez“)
bezveze, tims and tricks
([adlib] - „tricks… tricks…“)
Ko Vaskez, muscle build,
([BV gang] - „muscle, muscle“)
njima ide spomenik,
([echo] - „spomenik…“)
Pa polis (fucking flece)
([siren distant] - wiiiu-wiiiu)
Flight to Swiss, money moves
([cash FX] - „shhhh“)
Give me please, dobar niz, u biznisu Dibidus
([tapestop] - „di-bi-dus…“)

[Chorus]
Rani sati jutarnji,
([pad rise] - whoooom)
dižemo se skupa,
([gang BV] - „skupa, skupa“)
Ekipa prava, srcem jaka grupa
([chant] - „u-u-uuu“)
kad je dobro i kad nije
([echo] - „kad nije…“)
Držimo se zajedno,
([BV] - „zajedno…“)
uzori ulice, nadahnuti pravdom
([street FX] - distant traffic)
Sunce se rađa, ceo grad još spava
([soft BV] - „spava…“)
Mi na nogama, uveliko bistra glava
([head nod FX] - tkk)
Da bi biznis bio strava, mora da se radi
([chant] - „radi, radi…“)
Nema zastoja, zlato se iz blata vadi
([FX shovel] - shkrr)
Ko ti je u životu nek razume ko i shvati
([spoken BV] - „razumi, shvati…“)
Da bi danas znao ovo prvo mora da se pati
([delay] - „mora da se pati…“)
Onda presek stanja, činjenica se prihvati
([BV] - „prihvati…“)
Pa kud koji mili moj ' koliko ko sebi zahvati
([crowd murmur] - „ey, ey…“)

[Verse 2]

([FX camera] - click)
vama smešna svaka spika,
([chopped] - „spika-spika“)
Moj je Šoja, bratska dika,
([gang chant] - „Šo-ja!“)
metak primam za tog lika
([gun cock FX, low] - chk)
Ide hajp, u gađanju prvi
([adlib] - „hajp, hajp…“)
to je taktika
([echo] - „taktika…“)

[Instrumental Chops]
([scratch] - krk-krk)
([glitch vox] - „hey! hey!“)
([bass stab] - boom)

[Verse 3]
Moje srce lupa, lupa, ono tera 200 pumpa
([heartbeat FX] - thump-thump-thump)
Dobra nestane, koliko grama na metama smo mupa
([sirena daleko] - wiiiu)

([adlib] - „buksna…“)

([FX] - „beneluks… lux…“)

([crowd] - „kako, kako…“)

# hardcore_pop - Sound CCheck_Hardcore_Pop_1
[DESCRIPTION]
Meticulously engineered tech house built on robust, frequency-layered basslines and tightly tuned kick drums, pulsing with vintage drum machine textures enhanced by digital processing. Arrangements highlight drop-breakdown/drop structures, using subtle filter automation and clever sequencing for controlled tension and impactful releases, expertly balancing underground groove with mainstage lift, always club-focused and clean.

[LYRICS]
[Verse]
Microphone on her
Headphones on my head
She said
"Let's go"
And we went
Not where we thought
We were headed

[Verse 2]
It's like I'm already
Under the influence
Already in love
With what isn't yet
Something she said
That she hadn't said yet

[Chorus]
I heard her voice
And I knew it
Fell in love
With the way she said
"You hear me?
You hear me?
You hear me?"

[Chorus]

"You hear me?

You hear me?"

[Verse]

City roars like a sea of rumbling horns
I close my eyes and there you are in that nightclub
I lose my mind when I hear you say

# hardcore_pop - Sound CCheck_Hardcore_Pop_1
[DESCRIPTION]
Meticulously engineered tech house built on robust, frequency-layered basslines and tightly tuned kick drums, pulsing with vintage drum machine textures enhanced by digital processing. Arrangements highlight drop-breakdown/drop structures, using subtle filter automation and clever sequencing for controlled tension and impactful releases, expertly balancing underground groove with mainstage lift, always club-focused and clean.

[LYRICS]
[Verse]
Microphone on her
([Mic click] - klik)
Headphones on my head
([Headband adjust] - fffsh)
She said
([Breath close] - haaah)
"Let's go"
([Button press] - bip)
And we went
([Footstep start] - tap-tap)
Not where we thought
([Vinyl wobble] - wub)
We were headed
([Riser soft] - shhhp)

[Verse 2]

With what isn't yet

That she hadn't said yet
([Delay tail] - deh-deh)

With the way she said
([Pad swell] - ooo)
"You hear me?
([Mic check] - chk-one)
You hear me?
([Mic slapback] - yeah-yeah)
You hear me?"
([Echo] - hear me…hear me)

([Kick soft] - boom)

([Vocal chop] - ah-eh)
Already
([Reverse tail] - whooosh)

[Chorus]
Fell in love with the way
([Pad shimmer] - shiiing)
She said
([Breath close] - haaah)
"You hear me?
([Mic check] - one-two)
You hear me?
([Delay] - hear…hear)
You hear me?"
([Echo] - me…me…me)

[Verse]

([Horn bed] - meeep-meeeep)

# hardcore_pop - Spherecca_Techilim_Tech_1
[DESCRIPTION]
This 132 bpm house track pulses in Cm/Gm minor keys, layering a zurna's piercing timbres and ancient harp plucks atop deep clubby kicks and crisp cowbells. 80s synths and organ fill out lush harmonies, supporting a non-stop groove. Siren and tire effects add punch. Silk-smooth baritone and alto/mezzo vocals trade tight, rhythm-driven lines, enhanced by subtle, tempo-synced delays. Evolving textures, no autotune, deliver a dynamic, natural flow—energetic and immersive.


---

# hardcore_pop - Spherecca_Techilim_Tech_1
[DESCRIPTION]
Slow, evolving ambient tones form the backbone, layered with deep drones and ancient pipe organ. Authentic Gregorian chants echo in modal harmonies, woven with sparse chimes and subtle synthesized textures. The overall sound is brooding, reverent, and cosmic, invoking timeless cycles.

[LYRICS]
[Verse]
Veni creator dog's on fire
Make the boss's daughter smile
22-New Balance shoes
A dog's in a bun and you're-Mobile
Parent's child

[Chorus]
172277 hlen-GIshingen172277  parent's172277 hlen parent's child

[Verse22222]
VI-I parent's22-VI I GIshingen

[Verse182 to  Variation]
I

[Verse to camps]

[ dog'son]
VIIIIIIII222 as

---

# hardcore_pop - Spherecca_Techilim_Tech_1
[DESCRIPTION]
This piece fuses ancient Slavic ethno textures—modal woodwinds, authentic plucked strings, and deep male vocal drones—with ambient soundscapes. Slow-evolving harmonies gently swirl, layered over subtle percussion inspired by planetary cycles, creating a meditative, cyclical sonic journey.


---

# hardcore_pop - Spherecca_Techilim_Tech_1
[DESCRIPTION]
This 132 bpm house track pulses in Cm/Gm minor keys, layering a zurna's piercing timbres and ancient harp plucks atop deep clubby kicks and crisp cowbells. 80s synths and organ fill out lush harmonies, supporting a non-stop groove. Siren and tire effects add punch. Silk-smooth baritone and alto/mezzo vocals trade tight, rhythm-driven lines, enhanced by subtle, tempo-synced delays. Evolving textures, no autotune, deliver a dynamic, natural flow—energetic and immersive.


---

# hardcore_pop - Spherecca_Techilim_Tech_2
[DESCRIPTION]
Opens ambient with layered synth drones in slow polyrhythms, evolving pads, and sparse bell accents amid orchestral swells and sub-bass pulses. At 140 BPM, epic strings rise as Drill hi-hats slice through; heavy melodic 808s slide with harmonic chords. Cathedral-scale monastic chants merge with lush strings, while brass stabs, timpani hits, and cinematic breaks heighten drama. Clear, narrative rap verses cut through, all anchored by dynamic orchestration and shifting textures.


---

# hardcore_pop - Spherecca_Techilim_Tech_drill_1
[DESCRIPTION]
This high-energy Serbian drill banger launches with clipped, distorted bass and sliding 808s, locked to a relentless 135 BPM groove. Punchy, hard-edged percussion underpins rapid, stuttering hi-hats. Sparse yet sharp melodic hooks cut through, as intensely processed, fast crew vocals trade bars, adding a menacing, brutal edge. The arrangement is tight, letting each percussive and vocal element hit with maximum impact.


---

# hardcore_pop - Spherecca_Techilim_Tech_rafficca_1
[DESCRIPTION]
A pulsating, bouncy underground Balkan slap club tech track blends syncopated darbuka, kicks, snares, finger snaps, hand claps, and dynamic hi-hats. Unprocessed, conversational vocals move from breathy verses to a commanding chorus, with ad-libs and vocal runs. Car horn stabs sync with vocal "slaps," tire screeches mark transitions, and Turkish synths deliver melodic hooks atop bouncy bass. Filter sweeps, risers, and explosive drops heighten tension. Minimal intro builds to maximal choruses, using space and silence, shifting textures, and slightly humanized timing for authentic, high-energy groove.

[LYRICS]
[Verse]
And now I'm goin' in (yeah, ooh-yeah!)
I'm gettin' in (I'm goin' in)
There's no tomorrow
My friend (no, no, no)
No tomorrow (there's no tomorrow)
There's no tomorrow (tomorrow)
No tomorrow
Tomorrow (no, no, no, no)

[Pre-Chorus]
It's only right now
Now (yeah)
Right now
Now

[Chorus]
And I'm goin' in (I'm goin' in)
No tomorrow
My friend
Goin' in
And there's no tomorrow (no, no, no, no)
There's no tomorrow (no, no, no)
There's no tomorrow (no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no)
Tomorrow
Tomorrow (no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no)

---

# hardcore_pop - Srpski Electro Swing
[DESCRIPTION]
A 135 bpm tech house track opens with syncopated percussion, crisp claps, and dynamic hand drum fills driving the groove, Gritty bass and clipped synth stabs intertwine as bold, panned tribal riffs slice through, The breakdown features modal zurna paired  trumpet over interlocked organ runs, then a drop erupts with jungle-influenced vocals, catchy chopped samples, cathedral chants, and swirling echoes, The zurna and synth from 80s ebbs and flows, warping in the mix, as hypnotic, addictively rhythmic layers propel the relentless dancefloor finale

[LYRICS]
Kad tebe ljubim — bejbe, kad tebe ljubim,
Bejbe, kad tebe ljubim — u grlu kao da me steže (guši).
Sa tobom meko sve, lako klizim kroz noć
Sve je lakše sada — ti si moj bol i moja moć.

Kao svila u tvom dodiru,
Kao svila — meka, blizu srcu.
Kao svila u tvom dodiru,
Svila, svila — vodi me ka ritmu.

Ne znam ko si
Tvoje oči mi nešto govore
Neko si ko će:
Da voli
Ljubi
(Zagrli i odvede)
U noć bez povratka
(Tišina...)
Tvoj i moj glas
Poveži me svojim telom

# hardcore_pop - Srpski Electro Swing
[DESCRIPTION]
A 135 bpm tech house track opens with syncopated percussion, crisp claps, and dynamic hand drum fills driving the groove, Gritty bass and clipped synth stabs intertwine as bold, panned tribal riffs slice through, The breakdown features modal zurna paired  trumpet over interlocked organ runs, then a drop erupts with jungle-influenced vocals, catchy chopped samples, cathedral chants, and swirling echoes, The zurna and synth from 80s ebbs and flows, warping in the mix, as hypnotic, addictively rhythmic layers propel the relentless dancefloor finale

[LYRICS]
Ja
Ja
Ja
Ja
Ja
Svi mi ovde znamo šta je šta
Ko je gde i ko je šta
Ko je taj i ko je ta
Ko to skače- kao ja?

Here we go
Again
I know a place where we can dance
Don't act like you don't understand
Now is your chance to go all night (Oh, oh, oh)
I got you wonderin' why
Let's make this party never end
And we can do it again and again and again

A u klubu (a-ha) svetla gore, svi su tu,
Ruke traže ruke, ljubav kruži tu.
Kao da smo mi — ooh, yeah — za ples i san rođeni,
Večeras možda sija grad, možda došao i taj dan.

Oh.Dama ima tempo
S tobom bi sve odjednom
Sve odjednom
S tobom bi sve odjednom
Sve odjednom
S tobom bi sve odjednom
Sve odjednom

Ne igraj se sa mnom"

,Baš me to zanima,

# hardcore_pop - Stop! She Looks Gorgeous_Hardcore_Pop_1
[DESCRIPTION]
Minimal techno track anchored by a deep, static bassline, unfolding over a persistent eight-bar loop. Sparse three-note synths subtly phase against the rhythm, while percussion samples glitch and realign. Fleeting, spectral vocal chops weave in and out, textures gently morphing—mutating with minuscule, almost imperceptible shifts—so focus drifts between hypnotic steadiness and evolving micro-detail. The structure sustains gradual sensory transformation, inviting an immersive seven-minute listen where time perception blurs.

[LYRICS]

# hardcore_pop - Sunk Cost Fallacy_Priest
[DESCRIPTION]
Serbian Drill Banger (130-140 BPM)
Fast-paced variant emphasizing drill elements, Features aggressive 808 slides, rapid-fire hi-hats, and distorted bass, Arabic melodies are fragmented and used sparingly as hooks, Vocals are heavily processed with aggressive flows and crew chants creating high energy
– Show Summary

[LYRICS]
[Verse]
Too many times, man, we seen them losses
Too many times, man, we seen them costs
Man, if you investin' in me, better know it's profit
Or it's time to cut that loss
Two-two-two-two-two-twos, if you take too many losses
Better know it's time to move on (Move on)
'Cause you gotta think in the long term
But some man, they don't see that (Nah)
Some man, they just see all the time and the effort and think, "I can't leave that"
Not knowin' it's a fallacy (Nah)
Not knowin' it's a mindset (Uh)
Not knowin' it's a concept (Nah)
Not knowin' it's a project
But I know it's all nonsense (Nah)
That's why I gotta move with sense (Uh)
If it don't make pounds or pence (Nah)
Then you know I gotta switch, I gotta switch, I gotta switch, I gotta switch

[Chorus]
Sunk cost fallacy
Sunk cost fallacy
Sunk cost fallacy
Sunk cost fallacy

[Bridge]
Stuck in the cycle, can't see it straight
Blinded by time, drowning in fate
Got to break free, leave the past behind
No more chains, no longer confined



[Interlude]  
Counting the seconds, counting the hours  
Time slipping by, but I've got the power  
Every decision, a lesson in disguise  
Through the haze, I see the prize  



[Outro]  
It's the fallacy, the trap of time spent  
But I won't be tied down, through with lament  
Tomorrow's my canvas, so vibrant and wide  
Leaving behind what no longer abides

---

# hardcore_pop - Sunk Cost Fallacy_Priest_2 (Remastered)
[DESCRIPTION]
This high-energy Serbian drill banger runs at 135 BPM, driven by aggressive 808 slides and relentless, stuttering hi-hats. The beat punches with clipped, distorted bass and hard-edged percussion. Sparse, fragmented Arabic melodies act as sharp hooks, while vocals hit with intense processing and forceful, rapid crew exchanges, creating a menacing texture.

[LYRICS]
[Instrumental - Intro (135 BPM) - drill foundation: 808 mono <120Hz, kick 40–80Hz +2dB, HPF @30Hz; BUS: drumbus glue 2:1 fast, tape sat +1.2dB; ARR: 8-bar DJ-friendly intro, siren bar 7.]
(Too many losses, too many costs)

[Verse 1 - dry-aggressive lead; PROC: de-ess 5–8k, comp 4:1 atk 4ms rel 70ms, low-cut 80Hz, +2dB @3.5–4k; FX: short room 10ms, doubles 2–4ms; MIX: leave -4dB lead headroom, sidechain sub to kick.*]
Too many times, man, we seen them losses
Too many times, man, we seen them costs
Man, if you investin' in me, better know it's profit
Or it's time to cut that loss
Two-two-two-two-two-twos, if you take too many losses
Better know it's time to move on (Move on)
'Cause you gotta think in the long term
But some man, they don't see that (Nah)
Some man, they just see all the time and the effort and think, "I can't leave that"
Not knowin' it's a fallacy (Nah)
Not knowin' it's a mindset (Uh)
Not knowin' it's a concept (Nah)
Not knowin' it's a project
But I know it's all nonsense (Nah)
That's why I gotta move with sense (Uh)
If it don't make pounds or pence (Nah)
Then you know I gotta switch, I gotta switch, I gotta switch, I gotta switch

[Pre-Chorus - 2-bar riser lead-in; PROC: HPF sweep 400→2.4k, transient +2dB, delay 1/16 lowpass 3.5k; MIX: duck pad -3dB.*]
(Gotta switch, gotta switch, gotta switch)

[Chorus - group chant + lead doubled; PROC: vocal comp 3.5–4:1 atk 5ms rel 100ms, parallel comp 35% blend, exciter +2dB @8–12k, detune layer -12 cents; BUS: vocal-bus tape +1dB, low-mid dip 200–350Hz -1.5dB; MIX: monosub <120Hz.*]
Sunk cost fallacy (Fallacy)
Sunk cost fallacy (Fallacy)
Sunk cost fallacy (Fallacy)
Sunk cost fallacy (Fallacy)

[Bridge - atmospheric transition; PROC: vocal comp 3:1 atk 10ms rel 120ms, +1.5dB @2–4k, reverb 25% wet, delay 1/8; MIX: pull back drums -3dB, increase pad presence +2dB.*]
Stuck in the cycle, can't see it straight
Blinded by time, drowning in fate
Got to break free, leave the past behind
No more chains, no longer confined (No longer confined)

[Interlude - percussive fill; PROC: snare parallel dist +3dB, hat triplets, LPF automation to open into verse.*]
Counting the seconds, counting the hours
Time slipping by, but I've got the power (I got the power)
Every decision, a lesson in disguise
Through the haze, I see the prize (See the prize)

[Build-up - 135→140 BPM micro-accel; STACK: octave risers, gated arp, snare roll +6dB over 8–16 bars; PROC: automate vocal-bus sat +1→+2.2dB, synth LPF 1→8k; MIX: riser stem -6dB for DJ use.*]
(Drive into final chorus)

[Final Chorus - full-spectrum; PROC: double lead + detune -10–15 cents, parallel comp 60% wet, excite +2.5dB @10k, tape tails +1.2dB; MIX: open 6–12k +1.5dB, glue mixbus 1.5:1, keep monosub <120Hz, target -7 LUFS integrated on master for club.*]
Sunk cost fallacy (Fallacy)
Sunk cost fallacy (Fallacy)
Sunk cost fallacy (Fallacy)
Sunk cost fallacy (Fallacy)

[Outro - deconstruct & DJ-tail; BPM ramp 140→125; PROC: remove hats/top over 12 bars, plate 60–70% wet on last vocal, LP tail 6dB/oct start -6s, keep crackle -12dB; ARR: provide loopable 8-bar tail: monosub + riser + dry vocal.*]
It's the fallacy, the trap of time spent (Time spent)
But I won't be tied down, through with lament (Through with lament)
Tomorrow's my canvas, so vibrant and wide (Vibrant and wide)
Leaving behind what no longer abides (No longer abides)

[Mastering Chain & Reference - target -7 LUFS integrated (club), True Peak -0.3dB; CHAIN: corrective EQ (dip 200–400Hz -1–2dB) → multiband comp (tighten 60–120Hz / glue mids) → subtle tape sat +1–1.8dB → stereo imager (mono <120Hz) → final limiter ceiling -0.3dB → dither 24→16 bit. NOTES: send master -2 to -3dB headroom pre-limit; verify on club PA and earbuds.*]

---

# hardcore_pop - Sunk Cost Fallacy_Priest_2 (Remastered)
[DESCRIPTION]
This high-energy Serbian drill banger runs at 135 BPM, driven by aggressive 808 slides and relentless, stuttering hi-hats. The beat punches with clipped, distorted bass and hard-edged percussion. Sparse, fragmented Arabic melodies act as sharp hooks, while vocals hit with intense processing and forceful, rapid crew exchanges, creating a menacing texture.

[LYRICS]
[Instrumental - Intro (135 BPM) - drill foundation: 808 mono <120Hz, kick 40–80Hz +2dB, HPF @30Hz; BUS: drumbus glue 2:1 fast, tape sat +1.2dB; ARR: 8-bar DJ-friendly intro, siren bar 7.]
(Too many losses, too many costs)

[Verse 1 - dry-aggressive lead; PROC: de-ess 5–8k, comp 4:1 atk 4ms rel 70ms, low-cut 80Hz, +2dB @3.5–4k; FX: short room 10ms, doubles 2–4ms; MIX: leave -4dB lead headroom, sidechain sub to kick.*]
Too many times, man, we seen them losses
Too many times, man, we seen them costs
Man, if you investin' in me, better know it's profit
Or it's time to cut that loss
Two-two-two-two-two-twos, if you take too many losses
Better know it's time to move on (Move on)
'Cause you gotta think in the long term
But some man, they don't see that (Nah)
Some man, they just see all the time and the effort and think, "I can't leave that"
Not knowin' it's a fallacy (Nah)
Not knowin' it's a mindset (Uh)
Not knowin' it's a concept (Nah)
Not knowin' it's a project
But I know it's all nonsense (Nah)
That's why I gotta move with sense (Uh)
If it don't make pounds or pence (Nah)
Then you know I gotta switch, I gotta switch, I gotta switch, I gotta switch

[Pre-Chorus - 2-bar riser lead-in; PROC: HPF sweep 400→2.4k, transient +2dB, delay 1/16 lowpass 3.5k; MIX: duck pad -3dB.*]
(Gotta switch, gotta switch, gotta switch)

[Chorus - group chant + lead doubled; PROC: vocal comp 3.5–4:1 atk 5ms rel 100ms, parallel comp 35% blend, exciter +2dB @8–12k, detune layer -12 cents; BUS: vocal-bus tape +1dB, low-mid dip 200–350Hz -1.5dB; MIX: monosub <120Hz.*]
Sunk cost fallacy (Fallacy)
Sunk cost fallacy (Fallacy)
Sunk cost fallacy (Fallacy)
Sunk cost fallacy (Fallacy)

[Bridge - atmospheric transition; PROC: vocal comp 3:1 atk 10ms rel 120ms, +1.5dB @2–4k, reverb 25% wet, delay 1/8; MIX: pull back drums -3dB, increase pad presence +2dB.*]
Stuck in the cycle, can't see it straight
Blinded by time, drowning in fate
Got to break free, leave the past behind
No more chains, no longer confined (No longer confined)

[Interlude - percussive fill; PROC: snare parallel dist +3dB, hat triplets, LPF automation to open into verse.*]
Counting the seconds, counting the hours
Time slipping by, but I've got the power (I got the power)
Every decision, a lesson in disguise
Through the haze, I see the prize (See the prize)

[Build-up - 135→140 BPM micro-accel; STACK: octave risers, gated arp, snare roll +6dB over 8–16 bars; PROC: automate vocal-bus sat +1→+2.2dB, synth LPF 1→8k; MIX: riser stem -6dB for DJ use.*]
(Drive into final chorus)

[Final Chorus - full-spectrum; PROC: double lead + detune -10–15 cents, parallel comp 60% wet, excite +2.5dB @10k, tape tails +1.2dB; MIX: open 6–12k +1.5dB, glue mixbus 1.5:1, keep monosub <120Hz, target -7 LUFS integrated on master for club.*]
Sunk cost fallacy (Fallacy)
Sunk cost fallacy (Fallacy)
Sunk cost fallacy (Fallacy)
Sunk cost fallacy (Fallacy)

[Outro - deconstruct & DJ-tail; BPM ramp 140→125; PROC: remove hats/top over 12 bars, plate 60–70% wet on last vocal, LP tail 6dB/oct start -6s, keep crackle -12dB; ARR: provide loopable 8-bar tail: monosub + riser + dry vocal.*]
It's the fallacy, the trap of time spent (Time spent)
But I won't be tied down, through with lament (Through with lament)
Tomorrow's my canvas, so vibrant and wide (Vibrant and wide)
Leaving behind what no longer abides (No longer abides)

[Mastering Chain & Reference - target -7 LUFS integrated (club), True Peak -0.3dB; CHAIN: corrective EQ (dip 200–400Hz -1–2dB) → multiband comp (tighten 60–120Hz / glue mids) → subtle tape sat +1–1.8dB → stereo imager (mono <120Hz) → final limiter ceiling -0.3dB → dither 24→16 bit. NOTES: send master -2 to -3dB headroom pre-limit; verify on club PA and earbuds.*]
